story:
Powerful 

Shred up and down mountains, glide along the roughest of streets…

Ride for hours on a single charge!

Safe 

Pioneering rider stability through advanced electro-mechanical refinement.  Full foot coverage, bigger wheels and longer deck keep you in control.

 

Responsive 

Large rubber tires close to the ground maintain the natural flow of skateboarding.  Body-responsive technology from trucks to deck.

 

We Believe In Effortless Travel

 

Electric skateboard takes the ‘hard” part out of skateboarding.  The easy part, steering and balance, remain as fun challenges. We created this board for all shapes and sizes, skaters and non-skaters alike. The AIRLESS is made for everyone.

Beginners find the AIRLESS easy to learn, even without any skateboard or athletic experience,  using the specialized Beginner mode accessible on the remote. Learning with limited risk, we have seen the vast majority of riders learn in a single afternoon.  New riders often go explore their first day because they feel safe and comfortable riding at different speeds.

When you have mastered Beginner mode, proceed to Commuter mode which increases the acceleration and top speed.  Commuter mode is a safe cruising mode, and the most popular for day to day use.

Pro-mode is only available on the 2WD big battery and 4WD models, This unlocks blazing fast speeds up to 32 mph. The 4WD model takes it a step further with Adrenaline mode, adding 10 kw of acceleration.

With this competitive advantage, we embrace the rising sport of electric skateboard racing.

 

 

THE FEELING

When the AIRLESS is under your feet, the world is yours. Rugged streets, potholes, big cracks on the road are no longer threatening. As you learn to ride the AIRLESS, it becomes more natural. Even the slightest adjustment in the way you ride creates a new experience... Lean in, fall back, try the racing position, experiment with your stance; the AIRLESS conforms to your every movement using body-responsive innovation across the entire board.

It's you against the wind, exploring, ready for anything that crosses your path. This experience of total stability on the board at speed makes for a very smooth ride. Grass, dirt, cobblestone or nature trails... Real all-terrain power means nothing will slow you down, the feeling is total freedom.

 

AIRLESS DESIGN

Compensation for wheel bite, carefully calibrated deck flex, and body-matching ergonomics generate an undisturbed immersive experience. The AIRLESS board and AIRLESS tire are the result of intense research into all aspects of microvehicle design. It's time to feel safe and secure at speed.

Designed by riders, for riders.

 

LIMITATIONS OF A SKATEBOARD

It's odd that most electric skateboards focus only on the electric part, as if just adding electricity is all that's needed to scale performance. Our approach has been to scale the entire board by 15%, making it bigger and wider than a non-electric longboard. This scaling effect has increased the entire system's stability while adding lots of extra space for batteries as well as full deck support for larger shoe sizes.

 

TESTING


During and after the R&D stage, we pursued extreme prototype testing of the AIRLESS. In the real world, Mother Nature is not kind: mountains, rain, dirt, holes and bumps are all unforgiving. 
Our testing of this new invention had to match the harshest environments and weather conditions, including extreme heat. The AIRLESS surpassed all of our expectations. Our microvehicle is rated All-Terrain and All-Weather for a reason.

 

Hub Motors

  • Cutting-edge high torque 3 KW motors developed and tested by On-ix Boards
  • The 2 Wheel Drive has a combined power of 6 KW
  • The 4 Wheel Drive has a combined power limited to 10 KW
  • 4x higher than average electric acceleration on Pro Mode
  • Activate warp speed acceleration with Adrenaline Mode, only available in the 4 Wheel Drive model
  • SPEED: Firmware speed limit applied at 32 MPH  / 52 KMH on Pro Mode and Adrenaline Mode.

 

Lithium Battery

Our battery has been carefully matched to the needs of our high-performance microvehicle.  Even our smallest battery model can reach top speed at an unbelievable rate.

SMALL BATTERY:

45 minutes of fast riding

1 hr 30 min conservative riding

7.5-10 miles / 12-16 km

 

BIG BATTERY:

4 hr of fast riding

8 hr of conservative riding

42-50 miles / 70-80 km

 

 

AIRLESS Tires

After trying other boards and making DIYs, we found that the tires on the market were either too small (average boards) or gigantic (mountain boards.) None of which suited our desire for the ultimate board combining safety at speed, a shock-absorbing design and a low center of gravity.

Carefully adjusted through many revisions, our patented AIRLESS tire is the optimal size to take on any challenge of the road. 

  • 80 mm wide / 115 mm diameter
  • Anti-slip natural rubber

   All-terrain – All-weather 

Made to go over everything!

 

Extreme Trucks

With our custom trucks we were able to achieve extreme heat dissipation keeping both motors cool at maximum performance!

Next-generation trucks designed to provide excellent protection on the electrical systems
using a proprietary cable management system.

No more broken phase and hall wires.

Push the AIRLESS to the limits without worrying about breaking it.

 

Flexible Deck

The AIRLESS is a Canadian Maple deck dialed in to be the ideal flex while maintaining stability at high speeds. It’s wide enough to completely support up to US size 11 shoes making our deck one of the widest ever produced.

 

Foot Stabilizers

 

Personalized stance = smooth riding

Customizes the board to each rider's feet & height

Dampens impacts, acts as mini-shocks, enhances overall comfort...

Foot stabilizers optimize the foot contact areas allowing for increased rider stability and control, especially when starting or sudden braking.

Prevents cramping of the legs on long distances by keeping ankles within the center of their range of motion, reducing the stress on both ankles and legs.

Generates a shock-absorbing effect over bumps and obstacles that help the rider feel in total control, even at high speeds.

Velcro foot stabilizers can easily adjust to any height or be removed (using only one is also an option.)

 

 

Hyper Charger

 Because no one likes to wait!

  • Custom designed to be 3x faster than market average
  • 30 minute charge for the Small Battery!
  • Quiet, cool charge: does not get hot

 

Remote Control

 3 SPEED MODES: Beginner/Commuter/Pro

  • Unique ergonomic design for a comfortable, natural hold
  • Rubber dial for smooth acceleration and stopping 
  • Backlit display with: miles/km, percentage of charge left
  • Integrated flashlight. It’s a really bright flashlight!

 

 

3 Models of AIRLESS

Each dialed in to match the rider

 

All 3 boards have a specific advantage:

 

2-Wheel Drive Small Battery

Even though it is the smallest battery, the reduced overall weight increases the responsiveness of the board, especially when making tight turns. The lighter weight, combined with the flexi deck, is noticeably bouncier. When riding, the feel is closer to a normal longboard or snowboard with its deck being the flexiest of the three models. It's also the lightest, making is easy to carry. The Small Battery is optimized for lighter-weight riders, ideal for people between 100 - 190 lbs. This board includes our patented suspension front tires, made to take on larger obstacles and rough terrain by auto-correcting them. The Small Battery AIRLESS caps the top speed at 25mph, while the Large Battery versions have higher speeds on Pro-mode.

Of the three, the charger for this version is the fastest, only 30 minutes and you’re up and running again!

 

 

2-Wheel Drive Big Battery

The original board we envisioned. It has a distinctive vehicle feeling, more than enough power for most riders, but remains simple enough for beginners to learn on. It can satisfy even professional riders for speed at the same time. The deck is a little stiffer than the small battery version, it is optimized for riders weighing between 150-220 lbs. With a uniform weight across the board, it has a more grounded feeling. The 2WD Big Battery also boasts our suspension front tires, road and trail obstacles will seem like a thing of the past. This board has Pro-mode speeds reaching up to 32 mph; yet the shape, design and ergonomics make the ride feel completely sturdy and safe at speed.  It’s quite a rush. Considering the range is more than twice that of the Small Battery, up to 50 miles on one charge... Feel free to explore all day!

 

 

4-Wheel Drive Big Battery

Making the AIRLESS 4-Wheel Drive was a choice to support the weight of a healthy American Male. It’s like the Hummer of all boards. Taking the Large Battery version and making it 4WD means unparalleled uphill take off power, even on rough terrain. This board is optimized for heavier riders, between 180 – 265 lbs. who still want to bomb uphill like anyone else. It has Pro-mode speeds of up to 32 mph, but the extra-added feature of Adrenaline mode which unlocks another 10kw of acceleration! This is the board you’ll want to race with! With this version you lose the front tire built-in suspension but you will gain an overall more powerful board specialized for extreme mountain travel environments. The 4WD version has the stiffest and thickest deck of the three models, making it sturdy enough to handle the powerful motors inside all four tires. The feeling of this board is quite different to the others as the front and back wheels are all pulling at the same time. This, combined with the centered position of the batteries on both sides of the deck makes you feel like a serious machine is under your feet. It is. The extra weight makes for a very comfortable, smooth ride. The main benefit of the 4WD is the capability to do what you never thought was possible on an electric skateboard. The sheer power of four motors makes you feel balanced, grounded, and stable at speed. With the AIRLESS 4WD, the power is yours to explore any terrain, any trail, in any weather. Go off-roading all day long!

Blast up hills faster than any other board out there.

 

 

The AIRLESS tires have excellent traction on pavement which prevent power-sliding, unless you decide to play on wet wood-chips.

 

The AIRLESS Mass Production

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

We believe Indiegogo is the ideal platform for this project in adventure, exploration and transport as the vast majority of passionate people who understand the thrill of being an early adopter are right here.  

By participating in this campaign, you will help us bring this new innovation in electric skateboarding to life. Let's bring it to the streets! Let's bring it off-roading! Let's do it together.

Our team has put a year of effort into designing, building, manufacturing and testing countless prototypes until the AIRLESS prevailed as the undisputed champion to come out of our laboratory. We invented an entirely new concept in electric skateboarding and we are very proud of our creation.

Please join us on this adventure so we can ride together! We know you will enjoy riding the AIRLESS as much as we do...

 

BE THE FIRST TO GO AIRLESS!

 

 

If you are outside of North America, Europe, and Australia, please contact us before backing to ensure we can ship to you.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Innovators In the Fat Tire Electric Bike Industry Since 2013

  • Our Electric Bikes are Designed for Safety, Power, Torque and Speed
  • Thousands of existing Satisfied Electric Bikes Customers world wide
  • Innovative Products that are Affordably Priced

Introducing our New 2500 Watt Dual Motor System:

Choose from our Full Size or Folding Electric Bike Models with motors on both front and back:

  • E²-Cherokee Full-Size Bike with Camouflage Frame and Rims
  • E²-Grizzly Full-Size Bike with Matte Black Frame and Neon Yellow rims
  • E²-Buffalo Folding Bike in Camouflage or Matte Black Frame and Neon Yellow rims.

E²-Cherokee / E²-Grizzly: 

Play Video to get 360° Rotation Video

Full Size Specifications

Motor: 2500W Bafang Motors, Brushless Drive System with Front and Rear Dual Motors

E-Components: Proprietary Xtreme Dual Drive Electronics made by Bafang. All plug and play

Display: Bafang Digital Display with odometer, trip, mph or kph, power level, battery level, walk mode, backlit

Throttle: Thumb throttle

Battery: 14AH High Quality Sony / Panasonic Cells; Removable, Fuse Protected Battery

Throttle: Thumb throttle

Battery: 48VDC 14AH Removable internally protected battery

Seat / Seatpost: Quick Release, Adjustable Height

Tires: Xtreme Fat Tire bikes patented skull tire design 5” x 26”

Brakes: Avid BB5 disc brake system w/180MM Rotors

Derailleur: Shimano Avid 8 speed rear derailleur system with thumb click shifter

Pedals: Foldable pedals

Warranty: 1-year electronics, 2 years on bike

Max Speed: 26 mph

Full Size Bike Sizes:

  • Small - 17" fits 5' 6" and under
  • Medium - 19" fits 5'4" to 6'4"
  • Large - 21" Fits 6'2 and taller

Note: These bikes are NOT electric pedal assist

Pedal assist feature in this application has been found to not be the safest arrangement as bike will accelerate uncontrollably in some situations where it is unwanted and or un-needed especially in some off road scenarios.

Full Size E-Bike Dual Motor Rear:

Full Size E-Bike Dual Motor Front:



Digital Display:

Full Size E-Bike Thumb Throttle:

E²-Buffalo Folding Bike in Camo or Matte Black

Play Video to get 360° Rotation Video

E2-Buffalo Folding Bike Specifications

Dual Motor: 1250W Front and 1250W Rear Drive Bafang Motors (brushless)

E-Components: Proprietary Bafang dual drive electronics. All plug and play.

Display: Bafang digital display with odo, trip, mph or kph, power level, battery level, walk mode, backlit.

Throttle: Thumb throttle

Battery: 48VDC 14AH (17AH optional) Removable, fuse protected battery.

Frame: Complete foldable design for transportability

Adjustable height handlebars and seat

Tires: Kenda tires

Brakes: Tektro Aries disc brake system w/160MM discs

Grips: Leather comfort grips.

Derailleur: Shimano Avid 8 speed rear derailleur system with thumb click shifter.

Pedals: Foldable pedals

Warranty: 1-year electronics, 2 years on bike

Note: These bikes are NOT electric pedal assist

Pedal assist feature in this application has been found to not be the safest arrangement as bike will accelerate uncontrollably in some situations where it is unwanted and or un-needed especially in some  off road scenarios.

Folding E-Bike Dual Motor Front:

Full Size E-Bike Dual Motor Rear:

Ultimate in Power and Versatility

Whether you are looking for a green commute without the hassle of traffic or parking or would rather adventure off on mountain bike trails, through snow or soft terrain this bike does it all. 

Sportsman enjoy how quickly and quietly they can approach wild life without fightening them away. Whether hunting or fishing or just photographing nature you'll appreciate the fact that this bike has the power, torque and speed to climb adverse terrain through snow, loose terrain, brush, stumps, roots and more.

Our folding bikes are perfect for compactly storing the bikes at your home or office, on your boat, RV, even in your trunk.

Compare Our Electric Bikes with Others on the Market.

See how Xtreme's Dual Motor Electric Bikes compare to other popular electric bikes on the market and you'll be convinced we have a superior product.

Confused about Wattage?

Click here to learn the truth behind Wattage Claims and common Electric Bicycle Terms.

Features:

Options and Upgrades:

Depending on your use, we have included some great accessories and upgrades.

Win a Hunting Trip To For Two to New Zealand:

Every contributor enters our contest to win a hunting trip for two to New Zealand which will be filmed for Canadian cable show: Wild TV. 

(No purchase necessary see contest rules on our website.)

Easy Payment Program

Can't make the full payment now? That's OK with us. Reserve your bike with $999 Down and pay the balance once the bike is ready to ship.

Refer Your Friends and Earn $50 for Each Bike Sold.

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Join our affiliate program and get links and banners to share on Social Media.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Read What Our Customers Are Saying!


Risks & Challenges

Minimal to No Risks or Challenges in fulfilling Campaign Orders:

  • Already in Production!
  • We'll manufacture as many as are purchased through our Crowd Funding Campaign
  • Delivery 90 days after Campaign ends and is Funded

Our Crowdfunding Guarantee:

Frequently Asked Questions:

Q. How far will the Electric Bike go on a charge?

A. Depending on terrain and power level settings usually 20-25 miles.

Q. How much do they weigh?

A. The bikes all weigh about 70 LBS with batteries installed.

Q. Can I ride in water?

A. Our Electric Bikes are water resistant for rain and general use. Obviously, electronics and water don’t mix. Especially SALT WATER. Riding on the beach is okay, but stay out of the water. Warranties do not cover any damage caused by water of any type.

Q. What is the weight limit of these bikes?

A. The bike design has a max rider weight of 399 lbs.

Q. Can these bikes be ridden on the highway?

A. The bikes can be ridden anywhere a bicycle can legally operate. They are not legal to operate on limited access roadways in most states. They are classified as bicycles and not mopeds or motorcycles.

Q. How does the warranty work?

A. If you experience a problem, you must contact us before any repairs are made to the bike. We will then instruct you on the repair or coordinate with a bicycle repair facility nearest you for completing service if you are unable to do so. (Transporting bike to a facility is NOT covered by the warranty).  If you are capable of, and elect to make the repairs yourself, you must send us the faulty parts before we can send you new ones. We will direct you on diagnostics etc. Do not open or disassemble any electronic component under any circumstance. No user serviceable parts are inside of them. Do not attempt to cut or splice wiring under any circumstance.

Q. What service do the bikes require?

A. Bicycles, like any other equipment require periodic service and inspections. Your bike may require more or less service depending upon where and how you ride. Off road use will require much more periodic and in-depth service due to the dirty conditions that it will encounter. Head and chain bearing inspections, wheel bearing inspections and adjustment, tire inspections, spoke adjustments, chain lubrication and or replacement, brake adjustments are just a few of the inspections and service the bike may need over its lifetime.

Q. Does my bike have a title?

A. The bikes are sold with a bill of sale / receipt. They do have serial numbers stamped on the bottom of the bottom bracket or the front lower edge of the neck if you wish to record and or register your bike for insurance etc. No license is required other than that which may be required by local municipalities in some areas.

Q. Are parts readily available?

A. Yes! We carry a stock of all components for these bikes as well as most common parts such as pedals, grips, brake levers and parts, derailleur parts, crank sets, chains are readily available in the market place. We are also developing an affiliate sales network that will be able to supply parts.

Q. Are accessories available?

A. Yes, we have several accessories available and several in development.  Rear spring racks, front sportsman (gun, bow, fishing) racks as well as locks, lighting, bells etc. are available and we are working on a golf bag towing set up and several other surprises.  Stay tuned!

Frequently Asked Questions:Q. How far will the Electric Bike go on a charge?A. Depending on terrain and power level settings usually 20-25 miles.Q. How much do they weigh?A. The bikes all weigh about 70 LBS with batteries installed.Q. Can I ride in water?A. Our Electric Bikes are water resistant for rain and general use. Obviously, electronics and water don’t mix. Especially SALT WATER. Riding on the beach is okay, but stay out of the water. Warranties do not cover any damage caused by water of any type.Q. What is the weight limit of these bikes?A. The bike design has a max rider weight of 399 lbs.Q. Can these bikes be ridden on the highway?A. The bikes can be ridden anywhere a bicycle can legally operate. They are not legal to operate on limited access roadways in most states. They are classified as bicycles and not mopeds or motorcycles.Q. How does the warranty work?A. If you experience a problem, you must contact us before any repairs are made to the bike. We will then instruct you on the repair or coordinate with a bicycle repair facility nearest you for completing service if you are unable to do so. (Transporting bike to a facility is NOT covered by the warranty).  If you are capable of, and elect to make the repairs yourself, you must send us the faulty parts before we can send you new ones. We will direct you on diagnostics etc. Do not open or disassemble any electronic component under any circumstance. No user serviceable parts are inside of them. Do not attempt to cut or splice wiring under any circumstance.Q. What service do the bikes require?A. Bicycles, like any other equipment require periodic service and inspections. Your bike may require more or less service depending upon where and how you ride. Off road use will require much more periodic and in-depth service due to the dirty conditions that it will encounter. Head and chain bearing inspections, wheel bearing inspections and adjustment, tire inspections, spoke adjustments, chain lubrication and or replacement, brake adjustments are just a few of the inspections and service the bike may need over its lifetime.Q. Does my bike have a title?A. The bikes are sold with a bill of sale / receipt. Are parts readily available?A. Yes! We are also developing an affiliate sales network that will be able to supply parts.Q. Are accessories available?A. Yes, we have several accessories available and several in development.  Rear spring racks, front sportsman (gun, bow, fishing) racks as well as locks, lighting, bells etc. are available and we are working on a golf bag towing set up and several other surprises.  Stay tuned!

story:
African Female Motorcycle Taxi Drivers

I am Sandrine Nikuze from Rwanda, an African country of 1000 hills. I am passionate about making an impact in my community. I am 22 years old, and I work as a Country Director of an NGO called SafeMotos Institute. I am the one who started SafeMotos Institute operations in Rwanda, but normally, it is registered in the USA. However, it operates in Rwanda. 

SafeMotos Institute aims to end gender inequality in the motorcycle taxi industry and create job opportunity for females by reducing the unemployment rate in Rwanda. In the beginning, we had no females who were interested to become the motorcycle taxi drivers, but after a few months, we enrolled 5 females as a pilot group. With time, we enrolled again 43 females in the training. Now, we have three females who are working full time, and we still have 38 females who are still studying who to ride and 9 more females who are ready to start to work. We have inked an agreement with Rwanda's fastest growing moto-taxi company stating that they will employ any woman who ​graduates from our program. So, we know these women will end up employed!

I am raising money to keep supporting these females who are very passionate about driving the motorcycle. Many Rwandan women live in grinding poverty, and many people in Africa believe women can't be drivers. People say women are too weak, too unskilled, and to busy with household chores. There are females who went beyond all these criticism and choose a right path for their future, however, without your help, they won't be able to realize their dreams.

With the rise of money, $19,000, we will be able to sustain the NGO in Rwanda. I will buy motorcycles to give to the women and be able to pay school fees for those who are studying. In addition, we will be able to enroll another large number of vulnerable females who want to change their miserable life. 

I would like to give 10 motorcycles to females, and I plan that one motorcycle will give 2 motorcycles in 2 years. These motorcycles will be owned by females. All donation will be spent directly on these women. Our goal is to raise $19,000, but if we don't get that amount, it won't stop me from working. We will make sure that we start a few and grow fast. 

This is going to have a great impact because of the following:

  • The number of females who are unemployed will decrease
  • Female clients will be connected to female drivers where they will be safer
  • We are working to achieve Sustainable development Goals 
  • We are enabling women to work in the industry they were outnumbered

Our success will be majored by the number of women who will be working after collating the donation. 

If we don't get enough money, all these females who started to study will be obliged to stop learning, and SafeMotos Institute cannot allow that to happen. We believe in people, and we hope that if we join our hands all these females will be able to accomplish their studies and give a chance to all other females who want to join the program. 

Money is not the only thing you can donate, because liking and sharing is also a donation. Help us share and like our campaign, and in case you know anyone who might be interested in women's empowerment you can help us and connect us with them. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread our campaign. Thanks

story:
Where are all the Real Hover Boards?!

We created our company from one simple question: Where are the flying cars and hover boards we were promised as kids?  We realized that the only way to have them... was to build them.

Our Team:

  • Ian Schranze Founder of Forever Lucid, specialization in electric propulsion
  • Open Source Community of Engineers and Physicists
  • Bilal Naseem Lead Design Engineer
  • Awake Moonshot Ventures
  • Our Lead Consulting Engineer worked on the Saturn 5 rocket for the original Apollo missions!
  • YOU.  Yes you!  Your contribution will help us finalize our prototype and go into production.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to finish prototyping and go into production.

  • We need your help to finish prototyping and go into production.

    We are raising $50,000.  The funds will be distributed to:

    Materials and R&D for Final Prototype $39,000

    3d Metal Printer $5,000

    Rent of facility and equipment $6,000

    Total raise: $50,000

Your Perks

We have some Amazing Perks for all levels of your contribution:

  • $5  Handwritten Thank You Note

  • $25 Gold PLA OTIS model (12/2019 delivery)

  • $25 Gold PLA Smiley Face (12/2019 delivery)

  • $69 Gold PLA OTIS, Smiley Face and Forever Lucid Shirt (12/2019 delivery)

  • $997 The OTIS Electric Hover Board (02/2020 delivery)

  • $1497 Early Bird Discount 2 Hover Boards (only 100 available) (02/2020 delivery)

  • $19,997 Early Bird Discount OTIS Electric Flying Car (07/2020 delivery)

The Impact

Tired of traffic? With the Model OTIS, you can fly above it and get to your destination faster!

  • Imagine thousands of clean energy vehicles flying around with no noise pollution.
  • Our combined experience and past performance will ensure our success.
  • With your help, we can make real hover boards and affordable flying cars a reality.

Risks & Challenges

As with all companies transitioning from prototyping to production, there will be a margin for error.

  • We will work night and day to deliver your vehicles on time.
  • We plan to solve problems by leveraging our community and open sourcing all of our tech.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the Model OTIS.
  • Remind them to use Indiegogo for amazing perks

We are creating Affordable Electric Flying Cars and Hover Boards. And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

The ride-hailing industry has transformed public transportation as we once knew it through innovation and convenience beyond what we could've ever imagined. And today, more than a decade later, there is still an untapped market for women who want to benefit from that progression and also feel safe in their most vulnerable moments. 

Allow me to introduce Hitchr, a ride-hailing platform for women, offering a safe alternative when women need it most. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our goal is to raise $150,000 in funding to cover insurance for our first year-despite the amount of growth the industry has experienced, the ride-hailing business model is still very unique and costly for insurance companies to cover. The technology is ready to go!
  • To thank you for your contribution, we have some exciting perks that really allow you to be a part of the Hitchr journey as we grow
  • If we do not reach our goal with this campaign, all funds will be reserved and combined with funds from future fundraising efforts in order to fulfill our legal insurance obligation before we go live

The Impact

  • By contributing to Hitchr, you have an opportunity to make an incredible impact on the every day lives of women 
  • The success of Hitchr could lend itself to solving an unfortunate public safety issue that plagues our communities today

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you aren't able to contribute, we'd love it if you would spread the word about Hitchr and share our campaign

story:
Tideline has been operating a commuter ferry service between the Berkeley Marina and Pier 1.5 since March 2017.

We have received many requests to extend our service to other locations, like Jack London Square to San Francisco's Pier 40.  Our riders have described our service as....

"a life changing experience"

"a favorite part of the day"

"refreshing and invigorating" 

Tideline would like more people to experience a friendly, fast and affordable commute, that is why we are crowdfunding more lines of service between Berkeley and San Francisco

We are pre-selling monthly passes at $325 and one Roundtrip Tickets at $9.  We need $7,000 to launch, but more importantly we need committed riders to keep the service going.

Here is the proposed schedule:

Oakland Departures:                                                            San Francisco  Departures:

7:45am and 8:45am                                                                   8:15am and 9:15am

5:30pm and 6:30pm                                                                 6:00pm and 7:00pm

 

Each one-way trip takes 25-30 minutes between the Oakland's Jack London Square and Pier 40, South Beach District of San Francisco (including boarding and disembarking). Riders board at Jack London Square's Public Dock, between Scott's Seafood Restaurant and Lungomare's.  The BART and Amtrak Station are conveniently located nearby.

We have been so lucky to receive so much support for our service.  Tideline appreciates you sharing our campaign on social outlets like Facebook, Twitter and even Next Door.  Everybody deserves a great commute.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hello, My name is Louis Bricker. I am as stated above, a senior at the Steward School in Henrico Virginia. I recently turned 18 years old on May 30th. I live in Richmond with my loving mother Janet Scagnelli. My sister lives in South Carolina and is teaching a 5th-grade classroom. Just recently my family suffered a huge loss; that loss is my own father, Stephen Bricker,  a well respected and loving man. The disease which claimed my father's last breath left me and my family broken. This horrible disease which goes by the name of MSA is a disease which attacks the brain and slowly brings huge amounts of pain and also slows movement. When my family adopted me they owned a sports car which was a 1992 Miata in a bright red color scheme. My father babied that car and loved it until the sad day he was forced to sell it so he could take care of my sister Melina and I. My mother forced my father to sell the Miata when she realized he could only drive one of us kids at once and it was impossible for him to pick me and my sister up from school. Now after losing my father I searched and thought for many hours on what meant something to him and found it. The 1992 Miata was his pride and joy. I would like to bring that pride and joy to my mother in my senior project. 
  • I am asking for 6 thousand dollars to not only purchase the car but to have enough money for maintenance and anything else needed for the car itself. I will be buying the car and fixing it up so it looks just like the one my father bought back in the day. I will not only be fixing but I will also be taking care of and painting the vehicle to match the old one my mom and dad loved so dearly. The purpose of my Senior project is to bring a smile to my mother's face and have her remember all of the good moments she spent with my father in his 1992 Miata. 
  • I miss the smiles my mother and father used to exchange and would really like to see it again so I am asking for money to try and make that wonderful smile appear yet again on my mothers gleaming face.

What I Need

  • I am asking for $6000. This money will be going to the purchase of an old Miata, any replacement of parts for the vehicle, maintenance of the vehicle and any extra will be for parts which will make the car safer and more to my mothers liking. The goal is to finish this project by May of 2018 and to present my mother with her new car.
  • If I am unable to reach my goal of $6000 within the 40 day period the money I do make will still go towards the Miata. Any money I make is added to the money I get from working at Buz & Ned's on West Broad street. 

The Impact

  • I believe this project will not only bring my mother and me closer but will make her a happier person in general. 

Challenges

  • Throughout this project, I will be teaching myself how to paint vehicles, time management and my ability to have an emotional attachment to the Miata. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  •  I know that it is rediculous to ask all of you for money so other ways you can help me out is by spreading the word about my story and campaign or even just sending me facebook messages encouraging me to get it done.

I am asking for 6 thousand dollars to not only purchase the car but to have enough money for maintenance and anything else needed for the car itself. I will be buying the car and fixing it up so it looks just like the one my father bought back in the day. I will not only be fixing but I will also be taking care of and painting the vehicle to match the old one my mom and dad loved so dearly. The purpose of my Senior project is to bring a smile to my mother's face and have her remember all of the good moments she spent with my father in his 1992 Miata. 
I miss the smiles my mother and father used to exchange and would really like to see it again so I am asking for money to try and make that wonderful smile appear yet again on my mothers gleaming face.


What I Need

I am asking for $6000. This money will be going to the purchase of an old Miata, any replacement of parts for the vehicle, maintenance of the vehicle and any extra will be for parts which will make the car safer and more to my mothers liking. The goal is to finish this project by May of 2018 and to present my mother with her new car.
If I am unable to reach my goal of $6000 within the 40 day period the money I do make will still go towards the Miata. Any money I make is added to the money I get from working at Buz & Ned's on West Broad street. 


The Impact
I believe this project will not only bring my mother and me closer but will make her a happier person in general. 

Challenges
Throughout this project, I will be teaching myself how to paint vehicles, time management and my ability to have an emotional attachment to the Miata. 

Other Ways You Can Help
 I know that it is rediculous to ask all of you for money so other ways you can help me out is by spreading the word about my story and campaign or even just sending me facebook messages encouraging me to get it done.

story:
Why Bone Conduction in a Motorcycle Helmet?

Do you want to be able to ride your motorcycle and listen to music, take a phone call, or listen to GPS instructions? Are you concerned that wearing ear buds or ear plugs cuts you off from sounds you need to hear, like emergency vehicles? Do you feel like an ice cream truck with speakers blaring from your handle bar?

Would you be interested in helmet sound kit that offered excellent sound quality, no wires,a microphone,and allowed your ears to be uncovered for safety? Would you be interested in ear plugs that protected your ears from motor and street noise, but allowed emergency vehicle frequencies to come through? And would you want a control module with buttons that you could operate with your gloves on?

iheadbones inc designed and released the first stereo bone conduction headset (series 201) in 2009. We released our Bluetooth headset products (series 501) in 2014. We have been working with motor sport riders and helmet manufacturers for more than a year to understand the needs and also the limitations of existing solutions. We are confident that by combining bone conduction, Bluetooth and low frequency pass through ear plugs, we have a winning solution.


What is Bone Conduction?

Bone Conduction is a time tested safe and effective technology where sound waves travel through your bones to your inner ear. More Detailed Info Here


Why We Need the Funding & What You Get

  • We need the funding to cover the mold costs for the control module, the redesign of the control module to re-position the switches, for the FCC Certification testing and to launch the first production run.
  • As a thanks for your participation, we are offering perks that include our current Bluetooth products (images below) and offering Motorcycle Helmet Sound kits from the first production run.

Black Bluetooth Headset

White Bluetooth Headset


The Impact - Making a Difference

iheadbones has always been about safety - listening to music while being able to hear the world around you. The current solutions for motorcycles are annoying or even dangerous - speakers on the handle bars that annoy everyone, speakers in the helmet that need to be so loud you can't think, or ear buds that do not allow you to hear things that you need to hear, like emergency vehicles.

We are confident that our offering of bone conduction speakers along with ear plugs that allow low frequencies to pass through (emergency sirens) will increase safety and add to the motorcycle experience.

Risks & Challenges

We are confident we can make this happen, but then again, so is everyone...

  • We have a solid Bluetooth circuit design that we have been shipping for nearly a year and we will be building up from this.
  • Our manufacturing partner for this product is the same company we work with today.
  • We will be using silicon rubber for the control housing and we have not done this before, although our manufacturing partner has.
  • The circuit board redesign to re-position the switches will require a new FCC certification.
  • There is still a little hesitation when people hear "bone conduction" but this is getting better and usually goes away once they try it.

Other Ways You Can Help

So maybe you don't ride a motorcycle...

  • Send this to someone you know who does, or to a friend who knows someone who rides.
  • Participate but selecting one of our existing products as a perk

What We Have So Far...

This is our vision for how the control would sit on the side of the helmet:
                             
This is our mocked up prototype using one of our existing Bluetooth headsets:


         


Spec Drill Down

Since we are building off our current offering, the specs will be as below or better - 
Speaker type: bone conduction metal can transducers
Bluetooth version: v4.0+EDR with Microphone
Bluetooth IC: ISSC 1681S with Noise and Echo Reduction, 4dBm Transmit and -91dBm Sensitivity
Compatible profiles: HFP, HSP, AVRCP, A2DP
Frequency response: 20Hz ~ 20kHz
Wireless range: 33 ft (10m)
FCC ID: TBD - current product FCC Cert is 2ACP8-NICE2
Battery: rechargeable lithium ion
Continuous play: up to 6 hours
Standby time: up to 10 days
Charge in: 2 hours
Weight: 1.7 oz (43g)
Warranty: one year

story:
The first practical tool for light weight vehicle recovery that prevents injuries and saves lives!

Son of a Hitch is a portable, vehicle recovery system essential to any small vehicle emergency kit. Safely tug ATV’s and the like out of the mud, sand, snow, or ditches, when a tow truck is unavailable.

WHY SON OF A HITCH?


Simplicity Above All Else

Son of a Hitch fills the need for safe and easy vehicle recovery, which can be confidently set up and used by the average Joe or Jane to tug their light vehicle out. This is groundbreaking technology that can get you out of some of the worst road or off road situations, and should be part of everybody's car emergency kit.

We made the Son of a Hitch for the outdoors man and families who like to enjoy off road sports but have no safe way of recovering their ATV’s or side by sides when they get stuck. The Son of a Hitch is safe and reliable, but more suitable for pulling smaller vehicles, and much more practical for the average car owner.

Nothing Is Safer

There is nothing else like Son of a Hitch available to the average outdoor enthusiast at the moment. It is a unique product for small quad towing with no other competing products on the market. Typically, chains, tow ropes with hooks, shackles and tow balls are used in emergency vehicle recovery when a tow truck is not available. These improvised tools are dangerous and are known to snap or unexpectedly disconnect, causing injuries, damages and even fatalities.


Nothing Is Stronger

Strength tested at 35,000 lbs, the Son of a Hitch has a 4:1 safety factor, stamped at 8,000 lbs. The Son of a Hitch can be shock loaded at 8,000 lbs for one million cycles before it needs to be re-certified (this will not happen in your lifetime). The Son of a Hitch can be shock loaded with 3 ft runs to ensure optimum safety. It is no longer necessary to unsafely recover a vehicle using chains, slings with tail chains, tow ropes with hooks, trailer balls and shackles. With the Son of a Hitch users are able to eliminate the use of these hazardous towing mechanisms that were never intended to support the forces required to free a stuck vehicle.


Versatile

Son of a Hitch can be lifesaving, particularly for those who work in remote locations or go off road frequently. Son of a Hitch will be an indispensable tool for:

  • ➔Outdoor enthusiasts such as hunters, fishermen, campers and off-roaders

  • ➔Those who work in mining, forestry, the seismic industry, and surveyors, where off road travel is frequent

Son of a Hitch is light and easy to use, accessible to anybody, including beginners. Assemble Son of a Hitch within 5 minutes and be confident that your vehicle is securely attached for safe vehicle recovery.


PREVENT INJURIES

People are injured, or even killed when they use traditional vehicle tow systems...

Use of a recovery strap with tail chains   

Broken Tow Hook

Failed Trailer Ball

Shackle through windshield

COMMON INJURIES

Common injuries experienced with vehicle recoveries are due to drivers, passengers or bystanders being struck by flying metal objects such as hooks, chains, trailer balls or shackles used in the towing system.

SHOCK LOAD READY

The Son of a Hitch is designed to withstand the shock load of a vehicle recovery operation.

What is Shock load?  Most times shock loading is the necessary evil needed to free a stuck vehicle.  Shock load is a sudden increase of load that has a hammering effect on your equipment. Shock loading can instantly increase the load beyond the capabilities of traditional towing equipment and cause accidents.

FUNCTION

Removable U-bar allows for use of Son of a Hitch Fuse Link Recovery Straps.

Removing the pin and sliding the Son of a Hitch’s U-bar off the stock allows you to slip a Son of a Hitch Fuse link recovery tow strap through the U-bar securely mounted to the vehicle(s) or quad(s). Once properly inserted into the U-bar, the towing strap is safely locked into the unit. Using the Son of a Hitch with our Fuse Link strap eliminates the danger of flying metal objects while recovering a stuck vehicle.

PIVOT DESIGN

Patented Pivoting Design prevents dangerous side-loading

The U-bar swivels on a specially engineered high-tensile steel pin. The pivoting design ensures the load is always transmitted evenly from the towing strap to the pulling vehicle to eliminate side-loading. The broader surface of the U-bar helps protect the eye of the towing strap. Our patented pivoting design provides over 180º of rotation, which prevents dangerous side-loading.

ALUMINUM

Solid Aluminum construction is lighter and stronger than steel

Both the U-bar and Stock of the Son of a Hitch are composed of solid marine-grade aluminum. Due to it’s unique design, preliminary testing has shown the aluminum Son of a Hitch has a 15% greater load capacity than steel. 

FABRICATION

Crafted to the Highest standards using the finest materials

The Son of a Hitch unit will be precision machined and will be completely weldless and seamless. The two specially designed pins are attached together by a plastic-coated stainless steel galvanized 3/16″ aircraft cable to prevent pin loss and fumbling for loose pins. The Son of a Hitch will be made in Canada and USA by certified machinists and industry professionals. The Son of a Hitch will not mass-produced. They will be batch produced with the highest quality source materials.

DURABILITY

All-weather materials brush off the harshest conditions

The primary components of the Son of a Hitch will be made of aluminum which is impervious to corrosion from the elements. The pins will be composed of galvanized, corrosion-resistance, high-tensile steel. The Son of a Hitch is an heirloom product and will provide years and years of all-weather service and will outlast the quad, atv or vehicle it’s attached to.



Specs

  • ➔Weighs: 2.5 lbs

  • ➔Breaking Strength:  35,000 lbs 

  • ➔Assembly time: is 2 to 5 minutes

  • ➔For Beginners: anybody can use the Son of Hitch in an emergency

  • ➔Portable: Easily fits in the cargo box, trunk or quad rack

  • ➔Marine Grade Aluminum: Resistant to corrosion from road salts, or corrosion from the elements 

  • ➔Unique Design: Swivels with the pull to eliminate dangerous and destructive side loading

  • ➔Shock Load Ready: Strong enough to withstand the sudden jerk often needed to get your vehicle, quad or atv unstuck




REWARDS:

Son of a Hitch to Son of a Hitch

Using the Son of a Hitch system is the safest way to get your vehicle out of tough situations. Fully equipped and ready for vehicle recovery, this complete system comes with 2 Son of a Hitch units, the Fuse Link Recovery Strap, Snap Trap, 2 Quick Links and a Son of a Hitch System Carry Bag. 

The system works by bringing together a recovery vehicle and a stuck vehicle by inserting a Son of a Hitch into each of their standard 1 ¼” frame mounted receivers (or a 2"x 2" receiver with Adapter) and attaching them with the Fuse Link strap secured with the Snap Trap. With both the recovery vehicle and stuck vehicle equipped with a Son of a Hitch, it will ensure a safe recovery as the units can withstand the massive force needed to pull out a stuck vehicle.


Snap Trap Kit

Connecting each Son of a Hitch unit is a Fuse Link strap.  The Fuse Link strap is guaranteed to be the weakest part in the system hence the name “Fuse Link”. Use of the strap ensures no metal objects will be dislodged that could cause harm or damage to personnel and equipment. This 1” x 25’ strap is 100% nylon UV protected with a stretch of 8%. It will store 80-85% of the energy generated in a shock load situation. The breaking point for this strap is 8,000 lbs.

The Snap Trap is a kinetic energy diffuser that will capture a failed vehicle recovery strap or winch line which could cause injury to persons or equipment damages.  The Snap Trap is not to be used as the primary recovery strap.  The Fuse Link strap or winch line is threaded through the loops of the Snap Trap and tied off to a secondary location on both vehicles using the Quick Links.  No more flying accessories.

The Snap Trap Kit comes with one Fuse Link 1" x 25' nylon recovery strap, one Snap Trap, 2 Quick Links and one Snap Trap Carry Bag. 



Adapter

Some light weight vehicles on the market come equipped with a standard 2x2 receiver. By using the Adapter you can reduce the 2” receiver down to the same size as the 1 ¼” Son of a Hitch.  The Adapter comes equipped with a 5/8” pin to secure the Adapter into the receiver.  Included free for early Backers!

Designed From The Best

Son of a Hitch is the lighter, portable version of our first product, the Ditch Hitch Vehicle Recovery System. The original Ditch Hitch System is a tried and tested product, with a professional engineer certification from Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The Ditch Hitch System pulls 14,000 lbs, and weighs 7.5 lbs. Companies in the utilities and energy industry are our clients for the Ditch Hitch System, some of whom have relied on the Ditch Hitch for years. The Ditch Hitch has been the savior of many field operators working off road for companies like British Petroleum, ATCO Electric, and Shell –  just a few of our satisfied corporate clients.

Stretch Goal

We believe we have an awesome product that will help save lives.  We also believe that we will surpass our goal of $150,000.  If we reach $200,000, all Son of a Hitch kits will be delivered in a high quality plastic case.


Meet The Team

We are excited to make Son of a Hitch available to a wider market, with your support. Son of a Hitch is fully patented, and with enough funding, we hope to set up shop, and introduce this life saving product to the public.  We appreciate your interest and offer our generous backers generous rewards.

I'm Vern Sparkes, President and CEO of Ditch Hitch.  I started the company in 2004 while working as a safety consultant in the oil and gas industry.  Growing up on a farm combined with over 20 years oil field experience, I've witnessed my share of vehicle recovery mishaps and near fatalities. For the last 5 years I have dedicated my life to educating and raising awareness of the dangers of vehicle recovery and am steadfast in my belief that vehicle recovery incidents can be totally eliminated.

I'm Joan Sparkes, My husband Vern is President of Ditch Hitch but I'm the boss.  I oversee daily operations, marketing, finance, IT, administration, etc, etc and help to ensure things run as smooth as possible.  I'm very proud of what we have created over the last few years and believe we can make a difference in this world.

I'm Alesha Sparkes, eldest and best looking daughter.  My primary role is Director of Operations and Product Integrity.  My background is in insurance and sales. Between raising 2 children and trying to keeping up with my Dad, my life is always full of adventure.

Globally, we rely on an incredible network of customers, contractors, suppliers, engineers, manufacturers, developers, designers, friends and family.  Without their expertise, support and encouragement, Son of a Hitch would not be possible. Our sincerest thanks to them all!

Risks and challenges

Our team has the experience, flexibility, and time to fix any unlikely issue.  We're eager to communicate and collaborate with our backers. We’re very experienced in logistics, and we've built solid, active, and tested relationships with component manufacturers. Our first product, the Ditch Hitch is the leader in the industry and has been in use for several years. Son of Hitch is patented technology in the US, Canada and Australia. We already have established manufacturers for the Ditch Hitch in the US and Canada, so setting up shop for the Son of Hitch is no problem, all it needs is funding. With your support, Son of Hitch will be ready to ship within the year.

Son of a Hitch Gear

We’re very experienced in logistics, and we've built solid, active, and tested relationships with component manufacturers. Our first product, the Ditch Hitch is the leader in the industry and has been in use for several years. Son of Hitch is patented technology in the US, Canada and Australia. We already have established manufacturers for the Ditch Hitch in the US and Canada, so setting up shop for the Son of Hitch is no problem, all it needs is funding. With your support, Son of Hitch will be ready to ship within the year.

Son of a Hitch Gear

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Charlie Corry.  I started a small manufacturing business in 1991.  Our customers include Caterpillar, Rockwell, Flextronics, Benchmark and others.
  • I am a serial inventor.  I have an eclectic list of products to launch and I plan to continue using crowd funding to launch them.  
  • In 1992 I learned from a CBS 60 Minutes episode that vehicle seat backs collapse during rear end collisions over 30 mph and launch occupants into the backseat. The National Highway Safety Administration (NTSA) as well as all of the automobile manufacturers are aware of this problem but only Volvo, Mercedes and BMW have reinforced their seat backs. After the airing of this episode, I falsely assumed that this problem would be fixed.  Last year, I was disgusted to learn that nothing has changed since that 60 minutes episode aired in 1992!  So, I put all of my other projects on hold and focused on fixing this problem.
  • EVERY DAY, INNOCENT PEOPLE CONTINUE TO DIE AND BE INJURED because NTSA and the other automobile manufacturers refuse to bring the safety standard where it needs to be.  Sadly, neither our government nor the automobile industry is willing to protect us so, we have to protect ourselves until they do what needs to be done.

What We Need & What You Get

  • All we need is $3,500 for production fixtures.    
  • We will provide Safety Straps to backers.

More detail:

  • The $3500.00 will go towards production sewing and assembly fixturing. 
  • All backers will receive safety straps at a discount but the first 100 backers in each category will receive them at a 52% discount!!! 

The Impact

  • This is a very serious problem and it needs to be fixed NOW!  People are continuing to die and be injured because of politics and greed.    
  • I have successfully manufactured hundred of thousands of complicated mechanical parts for Caterpillar and others since 1991.        
  • There are over 2.5 million rear end collisions annually in the United States alone.  CBS and 60 minutes have been reporting on this issue consistently since 1992. I have provided all of the links to these news stories below.  If the CBS excerpt in my video wasn't enough to convince you, I implore you to watch all of these videos but try this one first:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YeTHbDKPyc8
  • Here is a link to the rest of the links and there are A LOT more:  https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=cb...
  • If you would rather make your own Safety Strap, here are the parts you will need:

                                                       The Safety Strap Bill of Materials

Quantity                                                           Description

2 Meters                47mm wide, FMVSS #209 approved seatbelt webbing

1                                Quick connect (working load limit of 1,950 lbs/breaking strength of 5,850 lbs.)

1                                #238 Bonded nylon sewing thread

*Stitching should be standard automotive safety box X pattern.

Risks & Challenges

  • 8 years ago, I funded but failed to deliver on a Kickstarter campaign.  It was a complicated Apple accessory and I was naive to the approvals needed from Apple as well as the electrical & software engineering required by Apple.  I learned a lot from that campaign.  When I failed to deliver, I vowed to myself that I would stick to what I know, so that I could be more assured of success in future campaigns.   
  • There are risks and challenges to any project but this is a very simple design that does not require any complicated tooling or complicated manufacturing processes.  Mechanical components is what my life's work has been since 1992 and I am confident that our team can successfully deliver on this project.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Even if you can't back us, we need your help!  Get the word out!!  Tell everyone you know!!  If you have any news contacts, please forward it to them.  Hopefully we can create enough pressure to force NTSA and the auto manufacturers to bring these safety standards to where they need to be.  No one should have to rely on an aftermarket product for basic vehicle safety, just because our government and the auto industry is blinded by politics and greed!   
  • Please share this on all of your social media outlets and use the Indiegogo share tools!

Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Even if you can't back us, we need your help!  Get the word out!!  Tell everyone you know!!  If you have any news contacts, please forward it to them.  Hopefully we can create enough pressure to force NTSA and the auto manufacturers to bring these safety standards to where they need to be.  No one should have to rely on an aftermarket product for basic vehicle safety, just because our government and the auto industry is blinded by politics and greed!   
Please share this on all of your social media outlets and use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
We want to bring this product to you, the world's most versatile folding electric bicycle.

BACKGROUND

Electric bicycles offer the same great benefits as traditional bicycles including cost savings (no licensing, parking fees or insurance required), improved health and connection with community.

The real advantage to ebikes is its efficiency in climbing hills or fighting the wind combined with better range. If you experience knee pain or exercise induced asthma for example, electric bikes can breath new life into the sport of cycling. 

They might convince your friend or significant other to join you on the trails more often or they might enable you to commute to work in extreme heat without perspiring so much. 

Cars and mopeds and neither felt as safe or refreshing as cycling along community paths, away from traffic.  

Electric bicycles remove many of the roadblocks and challenges that people face with traditional pedal-powered cycles but they aren't perfect. They can be complex, heavy, bulky which is a real pain if the battery runs out half way.

OUR OBJECTIVE

The Mild to Wild eBike started from our passion for optimising products and solving problems. We realised that that there are no folding ebike out there that is portable, powerful, fast and long riding range.

Therefore, we wanted to build an electric bicycle that will satisfy 3 needs, namely:  

1. Allow you to cycle like a normal bicycle. Mild when you just need it to function like a bicycle.2. Provides long range use with 3 speed modes.3. Wild when you need the power to move fast! Lightweight & Foldable; it will fit into Subway Train, Car Boot, Elevators etc.

We have developed an initial prototype that meets the above needs. The positive feedback and the support we got made us want to take this project to the next step: production. What we have now is an innovative ebike that is ready for the market: The Mild to Wild eBike.

TARGET CROWD

Most of us live in urbanized cities. Where makes car ownership simply unfeasible. eBikes fill the gap of providing mobility without the costly burden. However, ebikes are often built with the compromise of reliability, performance. speed and riding range. Many of them big and cumbersome. When they are light, they are too slow. When they are fast, they do not go far. 

The Mild to Wild eBike achieves a perfect balance of providing long range riding with a concealed 36v battery within the main ebike frame, secondary 48v rear mounted lipo battery unit to further extend the riding range. Most importantly, the 2 batteries will be combined to yield 84v for high speed travel.

FEATURES

3-option voltage selection modes: 
1. 36v with battery in-frame for leisure, relaxing commuting.
2. 48v rear mounted increased speed and doubling of the riding range, 3. 84v high speed combination for speed boost up to 80 km/hr.

Designed and built to function like a normal bicycle when powered down.

Rear battery compartment with genuine leather cushion functions as a pillion seat.

Comes with 2 chargers for efficient charging of 2 batteries simultaneously.

700mm Dual Crown Fork

Digital indicators for speedometer, odometer, voltmeter & atmospheric temperature.

Built-in alarm system with remote start/stop controls.

Front/Rear Left/Right Turn Signal Display .

Collapsible Front/Side Basket

SPECIFICATIONS

Motor - 1000w
Controller - 36v - 84v 1000w 
Batteries - 36v 12ah LiPO In-Frame Primary Battery & 48v 12ah LiPO Rear Rack Mounted Secondary Battery.
Tires - 16 x 3.0 inch tubeless tires.
Brakes - Front/Rear Hydraulic Disc Brakes.

COLOUR CHOICES

Black, White, Yellow, Orange, Red, Blue
Once you choose a pledge, we will email you to ask about your colour preferences.

***Please note: Backers are responsible for sales taxes and import duties, which will vary according to the country, state or province to which the reward is being shipped. VAT is included.***

story:
ONDAWAGON IS A FEELING

Yes, it's about Italian design, fine materials and state of the art technology.  But it's also more than this.  Riding Ondawagon is also a free spirit adventure, it's a jump into eco consciousness sustainability, it's mobility at its maximum.

 

Would you like to ask us some questions? Contact us on our live chat!

 

 

DISCOVER OUR PRODUCTS

 

Ondawagon Model T

 

 

Ondawagon Model S

 

 

FEATURES

Get an extra boost when your ride gets though: The Brose electric motor has a power output of 250 W and a torque of 90 Nm, which makes Ondawagon an optimal choice for both city and out-of-town trips.

 

In order to integrate and make it easy to assemble and use the many accessories, the double beam frame has been equipped with a sail-inspired rail. Elegant weatherproof wooden inserts guarantee that the quality will stay forever. 

 

The 4 modes driving, Tour, Eco, Boost and Sport allow for a personalization of your riding experience that adapts to any situation, ground and mood!

 

Two seats, full comfort: its original and innovative design make the Ondawagon a real two-seater eBike. Thanks to the double seat, the full comfort and relaxation of the passenger is also guaranteed.

 

 

SPECS: WHAT ARE YOU RECEIVING?

 

1. Frame: in AL 6061-T6 powder coated aluminium with double upper beam.
2. Transmission: chain transmission.
3. Central engine: BROSE S Alu 250W 90Nm.
4. Battery: BMZ V8 630 Wh integrated in the chassis.
5. Display Model: BROSE 1.5" TFT Allround
6. Tires: GMD B611 26 "X2.3".
7. Brakes: Shimano BR-M375 with 180mm discs.
8. Gearbox: SHIMANO Nexus 5 speed, integrated in the rear hub.
9. Lights: 3 front LED headlights plus rear light.
10. Maximum load capacity: 150 Kg, excluding driver
11. Cover and platforms in natural wood (oak finish)
12. Dimensions: length 2,270 mm, height 1,030 mm, width 760 mm
13. Weight: without accessories: 29 Kg

 

MODEL T

MODEL S


 

FOLLOW US EVERYWHERE!

        

 

AWARDS

THE MAKING OF

Endless hours to take care of every single detail.

 

Feel the passion. Watch the final result.

 

 

Icons made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com

story:
​

 


 

 

 

Dear Supporters,

 

Check out Our Website For More information 

www.thejumperapp.com

 

 

Welcome to The Jumper App.

We Have Always Believed That Roadside Assistance Has Always Been Pretty Laggy, Long Wait Times, Or You just Simply Dont Know Which Company To Call... Also, Asking a Random Stranger For Help Never Really Works Out Unless Your Some Super Hot Chick. So What Else Is Out There???  

I Mean I Guess You Could just Leave Your Car And Hope For The Best. Or You Could Download The Jumper App And Get Help Right Away. We Make yours options a bit more simple , just go with the more optimum service !  
 


 

 


 

Welcome  To The Jumper App founded By  Monjae Brown ,  Previously a freelance  Graphic Designer From Seattle, WA, And Co founded  By Juelette Stephenson a experienced family friendly barista ! together we Are seasoned visionaries with a history  of success ventures together!

 “We’ve  Always Had The Dream, We've All Had It. Having Started Your Own successful Company , Resulting in a low risk lifestyle for your Beautiful child, its a no Brainer.. But The Jumper App Was never completely about Us, Its About The People. Its about creating job opportunities as well as simple and efficient roadside assistance, For not only the consumer market but For Businesses as well!” everyone else who exists and drives a vehicle. New Or Old. And There are qualified individuals all around us in every community. And now we’re hiring them, For you!!

 

 

 

Think of it as "Uber" For Roadside Assistance Without The triple AAA Membership. You simply Open Your Jumper App on Your Mobile Device And Book Your On demand jump start, Lockout service, towing , spare tire replacement or even junk car removal. Remember this is On Demand Roadside Assistance, The Second That consumers book a service, it will notify a Jumper Driver in the area who fits the job criteria. Back on the road in less than 20 minutes.
 


 

Both consumer and employee apps communicate with each other which makes life easy. This can be a Part time, full time or just a side gig for jumper drivers But in a world full of jumpers your never alone.

 

We are training high potential candidates and will provide them with the necessary equipment to keep everyone safe. Our company compared to competitors seems completely optimum, that’s because it is! We are promising Lower service costs, faster arrival time , and competitive service level agreement. Our app is  efficient and very simple to use for even those who aren’t tech savvy

 

.


Come See How The Jumper App, a B2B & B2C / Hybrid Company Can Help Your Business Thrive With Services Like On Demand Roadside Assistance For Your Fleet Of Drivers. Schedule Your Demo Today !

Our Jumper App & Jumper Driver Fleet App Are Now Avaliable in the Apple Store. We Are Creating a community based business, people helping people , if you subtract The Jumper App from existence people would see that! The Jumper App has helped me understand if your business is built off of “you" and not for the greater good, then it wont be great or good lol.

We’re Raising money to fill these much needed potholes also to complete our product to launch and operate officially. Donations will Go To, Equipment, advertising, payroll Backing Etc

Welcome to jumper app and thank you for your support. Lets share this vision together. Be apart of the process and Stay up to date on business progress we’re proud to have supporters like you.

“The Jumper App” Team Players :

CoFounder: Juelette Stephenson

Partner:  Ernest Allen

Partner: Jian Pena
