story:
Inspired by the classic mopeds from the '70s and '80s, but with the technology of today, the M-1 merges software and hardware with retro styling.

Designed and built by Bolt Motorbikes in California


There is something inherently cool about motorcycles.  The M-1 delivers freedom and style with a twist of the throttle.  On an M-1, you feel like a superhero everywhere you go.  Hills flatten, distances shorten, and you don't have to pedal once.

The M-1 will turn heads and take you anywhere at anytime - just twist and go.  If you can ride a bicycle, you can ride an M-1.  There are no gears to shift, no clutch to grab, and the ride is whisper quiet.  Go faster and farther than any bicycle and get to places motorcycles can't.

The ride experience is at the heart of our design process.  As passionate motorcycle riders, we set out to make a motorbike that we were excited to ride, but also that anybody can ride.  We have riders who had never twisted a throttle hop on, and in seconds, they are riding like naturals.

Cruising in the park, commuting to work, riding doubles, or tearing up the twisties, riders find new reasons to get out on an M-1.  And the best part is that you can do it without a license, registration, or insurance.  

Playboy  - “Part of it is the cool factor.”

Cool Material  - “The perfect vehicle for the city dweller: an e-bike that effortlessly blends the style of a vintage motorcycle with the practically of a bicycle.”

Ferrvor  - “Password protected, a USB charger for your phone, and connect digitally through your smartphone, makes it one of the most hi-tech and functional electric bikes out there.”

Motorbike Writer - “A bike that gets it right with styling, practicality and technology.”

Engadget - “For urban environmentalists tired of showing up to work all sweaty, it could be the ultimate commuter.”

Top Speed - “There are a multitude of things to like about the Bolt M-1.”


The M-1 has rugged construction and is designed to handle mean city streets and off-road trails in all-weather conditions.

In Economy Mode, the M-1 is tuned to meet California electric bicycle regulations, but don't be fooled.  At 20 mph and with a range of 35 miles (city), you can ride all day, use the bicycle lane, and park anywhere.  You can even cruise into Golden Gate Park on Sundays when it is closed to vehicular traffic!

Sport Mode delivers pure power, style, and attitude.  Thrill-seekers and the adventurous can rip at speeds of 40 mph and have enough torque to climb the nastiest hills in San Francisco.  Feel the rush of a 110cc motorcycle without the responsibility of a 300+ pound machine.




100% electric (may contain traces of bicycle)

  • Steel frame
  • weight: 140lbs
  • carrying capacity: 2 riders (up to 350lbs)
  • Wheel size: 17 inches
  • Wheelbase: 45 inches
  • Seat height: 27 inches
  • Front brake: 220mm hydraulic disc
  • Rear brake: Regenerative / drum
  • LED headlight and integrated tail/brake light
  • Functional pedals

 

Keys are a thing of the past!  The M-1 is Bluetooth-enabled and connects to your smartphone.

  • Never lose your keys again
  • Share access with your trusted network
  • Remotely track activity
  • Crash detection
  • Listen to music (because now you don't have a loud engine roaring)
  • Navigation at your fingertips
  • Control security
With an internet-ready motorbike, you can do some very cool things!

If you lose your phone or your screen breaks (things happen), don't worry, because the M-1 is also password-activated.



Our 5-hour smart charger carefully manages battery health and ensures maximum range.  Simply plug one end of the charger into a standard wall outlet, the other into the bike, and press “GO."  Five hours and twenty-one cents of electricity later, you are ready to ride again.


We designed the M-1 with city-dwellers in mind.  No garage, no problem.  Our patented battery quick-release allows you to lock your M-1 outside, remove the batteries, and charge inside.



Let’s face it, getting around in a city can be a real pain in the butt.  The problem is that most trips are short, and existing options just don't cut it.

  • Cars are expensive / hard to park / stuck in traffic

  • Buses are slow / unreliable / stuck in traffic

  • Motorcycles are heavy / require a special license

  • Bicycles are exhausting / range-limited / slow

The M-1 solves these problems in a way that makes you look forward to getting around in your city, whether it is your trip to work, to get a burrito across town, or just for a joyride.  Don’t waste time in traffic or looking for parking; spend your time doing things you love...like riding your M-1.

In addition to the nuisance of parking and traffic, there is a need for renewable-energy-powered vehicles.  The M-1 is not only fully-electric, but it uses the most environmentally friendly lithium chemistry available, and our patented batteries are 100% serviceable and 100% recyclable. 




Nathan has a PhD in Mechanical Engineering and has always had a passion for reducing our environmental impact, including founding a non-profit A-Day-Without-Driving, a grassroots movement dedicated to educating the world about how we can decrease our carbon footprint.  He has brought products from concept to production in his last three startups including Intel-acquired Kno, electric motorcycle leader Zero Motorcycles, and wheelchair innovator Rio Mobility.  He has several patents awarded and more pending. 

Zach is a San Francisco native.  He has been building custom bicycles, mopeds, and motorcycles since he was 13 years old.  Creature Zach "Lee" Levenberg is known world-wide for his World Record setting 50cc moped ride from San Francisco to Tierra Del Fuego, a 13,000 mile and 6 month journey.  Zach was instrumental in the development of Lit Motors’ Kubo electric cargo scooter and the lead mechanic at 1977 Mopeds.  This guy can do anything!


Noah Sherman - Operations Manager

Noah has a background in business development and partner engagement specializing in growth strategy, emerging markets, management and public policy. He brings experience from small start-ups, large corporations and government.  He still loves his bicycle but can't wait to get his hands on an M-1. 

Kenneth White - Media & Strategy

Accomplished media producer, educator and social event designer with more than 15 years of experience and a proven track record of developing creative solutions that effectively inspire brand loyalty.  Ken is excited to be part of a team working on cleantech.

Stuart Philkill - Video Producer

Former founder of a video production company, Stuart has experience in business development, media and advertising management and creative direction. He's also a passionate environmentalist and avid motorcyclist.

Pearl Tin - Bolt Babe

Pearl has been a Bolt Motorbikes evangelist since its inception. She’s embraced Bolt’s culture and transformed her once wasteful lifestyle to one that is socially and environmentally responsible. She’s proud to represent Bolt and serve as COO of 501(c)3 nonprofit A-Day-Without-Driving. Pearl is a UCLA Bruin and has made a successful career in Business Development in startups of several verticals -  manufacturing, ad tech and gaming.

Steve Grigory - Strategy & Growth

Steve has been deeply involved in technology and creating consumer focused products for over 18 years. A veteran at Apple, Amazon and several funded startups, he has most recently been involved in App-based, On-demand Transportation. Steve received his B.A. in Electrical Engineering from Cal Poly, SLO. 


Marla Fong - Communications Liason 

Marla is a native San Franciscan who loves to eat and travel.  Her diverse background in tech journalism, communications, and organizing has brought her around the world.  After living in Beijing for three years, she returned to the U.S. to focus on social media management and web content development.


Don Hutchison - Advisor 

Don is a highly regarded principal, founder and advisor with a successful history of advising over 55 innovative start-ups.  He is the Founder & Chairman of Recurrent Energy, which raised $85M and then successfully acquired in February 2015.  We are lucky to have him on our team!

STARTER SWAG

 + Bumper Sticker + cool Bolt Mini-Stickers


M-1 STARTER PACKAGE

+ Bumper Stickers + Mini-Stickers


THE M-1 

 + 5-hour smart charger + 1 yr warranty



This limited run of 100 M-1 motorbikes is only shipping within the U.S.  For the rest of the world, don’t worry, your motorbikes are coming.  Even within the U.S., there is quite a range of shipping options, and we want to get you your M-1 as quickly and affordably as possible.  We will coordinate tax and shipping with each customer at the close of the campaign.

  • Bolt Labs pick-up in Brisbane, CA- Free

  • San Francisco Bay Area (within 100 miles of Bolt Labs in Brisbane) – $75

  • Everywhere else in the U.S. - we are negotiating nationwide shipping rates, but plan for $300 - $700 depending on your location and delivery arrangements.

We have seen a number of projects delayed for over a year due to poor planning and execution.  Many of these companies used too much smoke and mirrors in their campaign, and their design was not ready for production.  Others had a refined prototype, but their inability to scale to large orders resulted in long delays and unsatisfied supporters.

At Bolt Motorbikes, three years of nights and weekends have been devoted to developing the next generation motorbike.  For the last two years, our full-time efforts have been on the M-1 with a focus on design for manufacture.  We have created multiple prototypes, tested and refined our electronics, and we’ve had over 250 real people ACTUALLY RIDE our motorbikes. 

Our years of experience in product design has taught us that you don’t make 100 in the first run.  You make a handful to iron out the process.  The next 20 validate the process so that we can scale to 100 and more.  This scaling concept is embraced in our production plan and reflected in our rewards.

From now until our bikes roll off the line, we have a few areas of focus:

  • Refine the UI and Bluetooth connectivity

  • Develop cloud-based data logging

  • Package our charger solution

  • Order large batch of big-ticket items

  • Refine tooling for body and plastics fabrication

  • Assembly refinement

  • Production testing

  • First shipment


Bringing an electric vehicle to production has high up-front costs.  Your support will help bring production cost down by allowing for larger orders on big-ticket items. Your support will also help develop next-generation tooling and fixtures for ease of manufacturing and assembly.  This allows us to continue to offer the M-1 at the competitive price of $5,495.

Having proven the concept and technology of the M-1 with over 4,000 miles of aggressive testing, we want to get these beauties into your hands.  Your feedback will help us continue to make the best motorbike that meets the needs of real riders.

Support from the Indiegogo community also reassures us that we are on the right path.  It also uncovers deficiencies that we might have overlooked.  With such a diverse audience, Indiegogo is a great way to stay in touch with riders of all types.

Please share our campaign through social media and your friends.


The risks associated with this project are essentially the same as you would find taking any ambitious technological project to production.  We worked hard to minimize risk in all aspects of the project.

• Reliability: Some projects fail because their products are not reliable or rugged enough for consumer use.  Our motorbikes have over 4,000 miles of real-world testing of the chassis, drive train, and electronics.

• Sourcing: A risk that many hardware projects face is that of discontinued items. Our team has experience with production volumes in the thousands-per-week range.  We’ve learned the value of reliable sources and secondary suppliers for key items and embrace that philosophy in our motorbikes.

• Safety: Particularly with electric vehicles, it is important to have redundant systems.  We only use quality electronics and assembly practices, and all of our motorbikes have redundant safety built-in.

• Scalability: Another area many projects fail is inability to meet higher-than-anticipated demand.  Our suppliers can handle larger orders, and our assembly story leverages modular subassemblies to minimize downtime and switching between tools.  We have also implemented product lifecycle monitoring on all parts.

We have an aggressive execution plan, and are ready to face the challenges ahead.

How fast does it go?

To meet California electric bicycle regulations, Economy Mode is tuned for a top speed of 20 mph. For off-road use, engage Sport Mode to reach 40 mph and higher power.  

How far can it go?

In Economy Mode and cruising at 20 mph on a bicycle path, the M-1 can travel up to 50 miles (30-35 in city) on a single charge and WITHOUT PEDALING ONCE.  For the adventurous (and “for off-road use only”), activate Sport Mode for a thrilling 5.5kW, 40 mph ride for 20-30 miles.  

How do I charge it?

Our standard 5-hour smart charger carefully manages battery health and ensures maximum range.  Simply plug one end of the charging brick into any standard wall outlet, the other into the bike, and press GO.

If you live in an apartment and don’t have a garage, simply remove the batteries with the theft-resistant quick-release, lock your bike outside, and charge your batteries inside using our charging adaptor.

Really... No license required?

Correct!  The M-1’s Economy Mode is limited to a top speed of 20 mph and 1,000 watts to comply with California electric bicycle regulations.  Each state may have its own restrictions which you can view here.

In California, as long as you are 16 years or older and wear a bicycle helmet, you can ride an M-1,  and you don’t need a license, registration or insurance.

What do I do if I run out of batteries?

You can actually set the M-1 onto its center stand and charge the batteries by pedaling.  However, conservation of energy suggests that you are just as well off pedaling home.

How long do the batteries last?

Our patented Lithium Iron Phosphate batteries are rated for over 2,000 cycles before any noticeable reduction in performance.  What that means is that you can ride your M-1 30 miles a day, every day for 5.5 years.  Just like a Tesla, your batteries will last 5-8 years depending on how hard you ride.

What is the maintenance schedule?

Unlike vehicles with internal combustion engines, the vibrations that the M-1 experiences are far less, so nuts and bolts don’t loosen over time.  With no oil to change or valves to adjust, the M-1 saves you even more money.  Just like with a bicycle, periodic chain, brakes and tire maintenance are required.  The M-1 is smart enough to know when it is time to perform routine maintenance.

I've never ridden a motorcycle, will I be able to learn?

If you can ride a bicycle you can ride an M-1.  We have people who never twisted a throttle as well as experienced motorcyclists hop on and effortlessly ride away.

How does the M-1 handle rain?

The M-1 performs flawlessly in rain, though just as with a bicycle or a motorcycle, extra caution must be used for safety and maneuverability.  You can actually ride the M-1 under water (assuming it has very low ionic content), though it is not recommended.

Where is the M-1 built?

We are proud to say that the M-1 is built in the USA.  In fact, we just outgrew our home in San Francisco's Richmond district and will be moving to a sweet new home just south of San Francisco in sunny Brisbane.  It will serve as out new Bolt Labs for development and construction, showroom, and demo rides.  Drop by to say hello!

What does the 1 year warranty cover?

Our warranty covers all manufacturing defects and not parts with damage due to abuse or misuse.  We provide technical support and consultation.

This warranty is effective only if the product is used under normal conditions for its intended purpose and the product receives all necessary maintenance and adjustments.  We reserve the right to determine what damage is due to defective materials and what is due to product abuse or misuse.  All warranties are void if abuse or misuse is detected.  

This warranty extends only to the original customer and is non-transferrable.

Common wear items are not covered under warranty, such as tires, brakes, lights, rubber covers, seat covers, and other plastic parts. 

Does the warranty cover me if I don’t live in California?

The same as above.  However, if a shipment is required, you must pay for the shipment of the broken part to our service center via UPS, FedEx, or US Postal. When we receive the broken part, we will ship you a replacement part free of charge.

I'm tall.  Will this work for me?

We’ve had people as tall as 6'7" ride an M-1.  If you’re shorter than that, the M-1 is perfect for you.  Actually, the taller you are, the more like a supersport motorcycle it feels.  We are motorcycle riders and particularly love supersport, so that was our inspiration.  We think you will like it as well.

I'm short.  Will this work for me?

We've had petite 5'0" ladies hop on the M-1 and transform into total badasses (5'0" men do the same).  The M-1 is light enough to be comfortably managed by a smaller person.  We suggest riders are at least 4'11" to ride. 

Is this M-1 model the same for men and women?

It sure is.  Women and men love the M-1 equally and every test rider comes back with a grin that just won't quit.  

Is there a weight limit?

The M-1 accommodates 2 riders or up to 350lbs.  Passenger pegs are sold separately through our website.

What about theft?

There is no substitute for good judgment, and that includes where you lock your  M-1.  Nothing is theft-proof but we can slow thieves down.  First, the M-1 is keyless and password protected.  Only you and authorized users can start your M-1.  When locking outside, we recommend a 9" U-lock that you can buy at any bicycle shop, hardware store, or online.  Simply lock your M-1 to a bicycle rack as you would a regular bicycle, and your M-1 should be right where you left it when you return.

Can I customize my bike?

Not quite yet.  Currently, the M-1 Bolt Motorbike is available in Classic Black, but we're working on other color schemes and aftermarket upgrades including passenger pegs, storage and basket options, extra batteries, and more.  Everything not listed here will be available through our website, so stay tuned.  If you have specific requests or cool ideas, please contact us directly...we wanna hear from you!

From the team at Bolt Motorbikes, many thanks to all of our contributors and supporters along the way.  We would not be where we are without you!

We also want to give a little shout out to a few specific folks:
Wind River / HEXO+ / Slick / KID-Group / Treatland / Creatures of the Loin 
Elliot Ortiz / Monica Semergiu / Josh Franta / Quan Pham
Miguel de Ocampo / David "Ciao" Wajsfelner / Ace Levenberg 
Harvey and Donna /  P.O.V.

Most importantly, thanks to our partners for putting up with the long hours to date (and for those to come).

If you lose your phone or your screen breaks (things happen), don't worry, because the M-1 is also password-activated.




Our 5-hour smart charger carefully manages battery health and ensures maximum range.  Simply plug one end of the charger into a standard wall outlet, the other into the bike, and press “GO."  Five hours and twenty-one cents of electricity later, you are ready to ride again.

We designed the M-1 with city-dwellers in mind.  No garage, no problem.  Our patented battery quick-release allows you to lock your M-1 outside, remove the batteries, and charge inside.








Let’s face it, getting around in a city can be a real pain in the butt.  The problem is that most trips are short, and existing options just don't cut it.


Cars are expensive / hard to park / stuck in traffic
Buses are slow / unreliable / stuck in traffic
Motorcycles are heavy / require a special license
Bicycles are exhausting / range-limited / slow



The M-1 solves these problems in a way that makes you look forward to getting around in your city, whether it is your trip to work, to get a burrito across town, or just for a joyride.  Don’t waste time in traffic or looking for parking; spend your time doing things you love...like riding your M-1.
In addition to the nuisance of parking and traffic, there is a need for renewable-energy-powered vehicles.  The M-1 is not only fully-electric, but it uses the most environmentally friendly lithium chemistry available, and our patented batteries are 100% serviceable and 100% recyclable. 





Nathan has a PhD in Mechanical Engineering and has always had a passion for reducing our environmental impact, including founding a non-profit A-Day-Without-Driving, a grassroots movement dedicated to educating the world about how we can decrease our carbon footprint.  He has brought products from concept to production in his last three startups including Intel-acquired Kno, electric motorcycle leader Zero Motorcycles, and wheelchair innovator Rio Mobility.  He has several patents awarded and more pending. 
Zach is a San Francisco native.  He has been building custom bicycles, mopeds, and motorcycles since he was 13 years old.  Creature Zach "Lee" Levenberg is known world-wide for his World Record setting 50cc moped ride from San Francisco to Tierra Del Fuego, a 13,000 mile and 6 month journey.  Zach was instrumental in the development of Lit Motors’ Kubo electric cargo scooter and the lead mechanic at 1977 Mopeds.  This guy can do anything!








Noah Sherman - Operations Manager
Noah has a background in business development and partner engagement specializing in growth strategy, emerging markets, management and public policy. He brings experience from small start-ups, large corporations and government.  He still loves his bicycle but can't wait to get his hands on an M-1. 





Kenneth White - Media & Strategy
Accomplished media producer, educator and social event designer with more than 15 years of experience and a proven track record of developing creative solutions that effectively inspire brand loyalty.  Ken is excited to be part of a team working on cleantech.





Stuart Philkill - Video Producer
Former founder of a video production company, Stuart has experience in business development, media and advertising management and creative direction. He's also a passionate environmentalist and avid motorcyclist.





Pearl Tin - Bolt Babe
Pearl has been a Bolt Motorbikes evangelist since its inception. She’s embraced Bolt’s culture and transformed her once wasteful lifestyle to one that is socially and environmentally responsible. She’s proud to represent Bolt and serve as COO of 501(c)3 nonprofit A-Day-Without-Driving. Pearl is a UCLA Bruin and has made a successful career in Business Development in startups of several verticals -  manufacturing, ad tech and gaming.





Steve Grigory - Strategy & Growth
Steve has been deeply involved in technology and creating consumer focused products for over 18 years. A veteran at Apple, Amazon and several funded startups, he has most recently been involved in App-based, On-demand Transportation. Steve received his B.A. in Electrical Engineering from Cal Poly, SLO. 








Marla Fong - Communications Liason 
Marla is a native San Franciscan who loves to eat and travel.  Her diverse background in tech journalism, communications, and organizing has brought her around the world.  After living in Beijing for three years, she returned to the U.S. to focus on social media management and web content development.








Don Hutchison - Advisor 
Don is a highly regarded principal, founder and advisor with a successful history of advising over 55 innovative start-ups.  He is the Founder & Chairman of Recurrent Energy, which raised $85M and then successfully acquired in February 2015.  We are lucky to have him on our team!






STARTER SWAG





 + Bumper Sticker + cool Bolt Mini-Stickers

M-1 STARTER PACKAGE


+ Bumper Stickers + Mini-Stickers



THE M-1 

 + 5-hour smart charger + 1 yr warranty


This limited run of 100 M-1 motorbikes is only shipping within the U.S.  For the rest of the world, don’t worry, your motorbikes are coming.  Even within the U.S., there is quite a range of shipping options, and we want to get you your M-1 as quickly and affordably as possible.  We will coordinate tax and shipping with each customer at the close of the campaign.

Bolt Labs pick-up in Brisbane, CA- Free
San Francisco Bay Area (within 100 miles of Bolt Labs in Brisbane) – $75
Everywhere else in the U.S. - we are negotiating nationwide shipping rates, but plan for $300 - $700 depending on your location and delivery arrangements.




We have seen a number of projects delayed for over a year due to poor planning and execution.  Many of these companies used too much smoke and mirrors in their campaign, and their design was not ready for production.  Others had a refined prototype, but their inability to scale to large orders resulted in long delays and unsatisfied supporters.
At Bolt Motorbikes, three years of nights and weekends have been devoted to developing the next generation motorbike.  For the last two years, our full-time efforts have been on the M-1 with a focus on design for manufacture.  We have created multiple prototypes, tested and refined our electronics, and we’ve had over 250 real people ACTUALLY RIDE our motorbikes. 
Our years of experience in product design has taught us that you don’t make 100 in the first run.  You make a handful to iron out the process.  The next 20 validate the process so that we can scale to 100 and more.  This scaling concept is embraced in our production plan and reflected in our rewards.
From now until our bikes roll off the line, we have a few areas of focus:



Refine the UI and Bluetooth connectivity
Develop cloud-based data logging
Package our charger solution
Order large batch of big-ticket items
Refine tooling for body and plastics fabrication
Assembly refinement
Production testing
First shipment





Bringing an electric vehicle to production has high up-front costs.  Your support will help bring production cost down by allowing for larger orders on big-ticket items. Your support will also help develop next-generation tooling and fixtures for ease of manufacturing and assembly.  This allows us to continue to offer the M-1 at the competitive price of $5,495.
Having proven the concept and technology of the M-1 with over 4,000 miles of aggressive testing, we want to get these beauties into your hands.  Your feedback will help us continue to make the best motorbike that meets the needs of real riders.
Support from the Indiegogo community also reassures us that we are on the right path.  It also uncovers deficiencies that we might have overlooked.  With such a diverse audience, Indiegogo is a great way to stay in touch with riders of all types.Please share our campaign through social media and your friends.



The risks associated with this project are essentially the same as you would find taking any ambitious technological project to production.  We worked hard to minimize risk in all aspects of the project.
• Reliability: Some projects fail because their products are not reliable or rugged enough for consumer use.  Our motorbikes have over 4,000 miles of real-world testing of the chassis, drive train, and electronics.
• Sourcing: A risk that many hardware projects face is that of discontinued items. Our team has experience with production volumes in the thousands-per-week range.  We’ve learned the value of reliable sources and secondary suppliers for key items and embrace that philosophy in our motorbikes.
• Safety: Particularly with electric vehicles, it is important to have redundant systems.  We only use quality electronics and assembly practices, and all of our motorbikes have redundant safety built-in.
• Scalability: Another area many projects fail is inability to meet higher-than-anticipated demand.  Our suppliers can handle larger orders, and our assembly story leverages modular subassemblies to minimize downtime and switching between tools.  We have also implemented product lifecycle monitoring on all parts.We have an aggressive execution plan, and are ready to face the challenges ahead.



How fast does it go?
To meet California electric bicycle regulations, Economy Mode is tuned for a top speed of 20 mph. For off-road use, engage Sport Mode to reach 40 mph and higher power.  
How far can it go?
In Economy Mode and cruising at 20 mph on a bicycle path, the M-1 can travel up to 50 miles (30-35 in city) on a single charge and WITHOUT PEDALING ONCE.  For the adventurous (and “for off-road use only”), activate Sport Mode for a thrilling 5.5kW, 40 mph ride for 20-30 miles.  
How do I charge it?
Our standard 5-hour smart charger carefully manages battery health and ensures maximum range.  Simply plug one end of the charging brick into any standard wall outlet, the other into the bike, and press GO.
If you live in an apartment and don’t have a garage, simply remove the batteries with the theft-resistant quick-release, lock your bike outside, and charge your batteries inside using our charging adaptor. 
Really... No license required?
Correct!  The M-1’s Economy Mode is limited to a top speed of 20 mph and 1,000 watts to comply with California electric bicycle regulations.  Each state may have its own restrictions which you can view here.
In California, as long as you are 16 years or older and wear a bicycle helmet, you can ride an M-1,  and you don’t need a license, registration or insurance. 
What do I do if I run out of batteries?
You can actually set the M-1 onto its center stand and charge the batteries by pedaling.  However, conservation of energy suggests that you are just as well off pedaling home.
How long do the batteries last?
Our patented Lithium Iron Phosphate batteries are rated for over 2,000 cycles before any noticeable reduction in performance.  What that means is that you can ride your M-1 30 miles a day, every day for 5.5 years.  Just like a Tesla, your batteries will last 5-8 years depending on how hard you ride.
What is the maintenance schedule?
Unlike vehicles with internal combustion engines, the vibrations that the M-1 experiences are far less, so nuts and bolts don’t loosen over time.  With no oil to change or valves to adjust, the M-1 saves you even more money.  Just like with a bicycle, periodic chain, brakes and tire maintenance are required.  The M-1 is smart enough to know when it is time to perform routine maintenance.
I've never ridden a motorcycle, will I be able to learn?
If you can ride a bicycle you can ride an M-1.  We have people who never twisted a throttle as well as experienced motorcyclists hop on and effortlessly ride away. 
How does the M-1 handle rain?
The M-1 performs flawlessly in rain, though just as with a bicycle or a motorcycle, extra caution must be used for safety and maneuverability.  You can actually ride the M-1 under water (assuming it has very low ionic content), though it is not recommended.
Where is the M-1 built?
We are proud to say that the M-1 is built in the USA.  In fact, we just outgrew our home in San Francisco's Richmond district and will be moving to a sweet new home just south of San Francisco in sunny Brisbane.  It will serve as out new Bolt Labs for development and construction, showroom, and demo rides.  Drop by to say hello!
What does the 1 year warranty cover?
Our warranty covers all manufacturing defects and not parts with damage due to abuse or misuse.  We provide technical support and consultation.
This warranty is effective only if the product is used under normal conditions for its intended purpose and the product receives all necessary maintenance and adjustments.  We reserve the right to determine what damage is due to defective materials and what is due to product abuse or misuse.  All warranties are void if abuse or misuse is detected.  
This warranty extends only to the original customer and is non-transferrable.
Common wear items are not covered under warranty, such as tires, brakes, lights, rubber covers, seat covers, and other plastic parts. 
Does the warranty cover me if I don’t live in California?
The same as above.  However, if a shipment is required, you must pay for the shipment of the broken part to our service center via UPS, FedEx, or US Postal. When we receive the broken part, we will ship you a replacement part free of charge.
I'm tall.  Will this work for me?
We’ve had people as tall as 6'7" ride an M-1.  If you’re shorter than that, the M-1 is perfect for you.  Actually, the taller you are, the more like a supersport motorcycle it feels.  We are motorcycle riders and particularly love supersport, so that was our inspiration.  We think you will like it as well.
I'm short.  Will this work for me?
We've had petite 5'0" ladies hop on the M-1 and transform into total badasses (5'0" men do the same).  The M-1 is light enough to be comfortably managed by a smaller person.  We suggest riders are at least 4'11" to ride. 
Is this M-1 model the same for men and women?
It sure is.  Women and men love the M-1 equally and every test rider comes back with a grin that just won't quit.  
Is there a weight limit?
The M-1 accommodates 2 riders or up to 350lbs.  Passenger pegs are sold separately through our website.
What about theft?
There is no substitute for good judgment, and that includes where you lock your  M-1.  Nothing is theft-proof but we can slow thieves down.  First, the M-1 is keyless and password protected.  Only you and authorized users can start your M-1.  When locking outside, we recommend a 9" U-lock that you can buy at any bicycle shop, hardware store, or online.  Simply lock your M-1 to a bicycle rack as you would a regular bicycle, and your M-1 should be right where you left it when you return.
Can I customize my bike?Not quite yet.  Currently, the M-1 Bolt Motorbike is available in Classic Black, but we're working on other color schemes and aftermarket upgrades including passenger pegs, storage and basket options, extra batteries, and more.  Everything not listed here will be available through our website, so stay tuned.  If you have specific requests or cool ideas, please contact us directly...we wanna hear from you!



From the team at Bolt Motorbikes, many thanks to all of our contributors and supporters along the way.  We would not be where we are without you!We also want to give a little shout out to a few specific folks:


Wind River / HEXO+ / Slick / KID-Group / Treatland / Creatures of the Loin 


Elliot Ortiz / Monica Semergiu / Josh Franta / Quan Pham


Miguel de Ocampo / David "Ciao" Wajsfelner / Ace Levenberg 


Harvey and Donna /  P.O.V.

Most importantly, thanks to our partners for putting up with the long hours to date (and for those to come).

story:
Watch the video above and show your support for Artis Hughes, the Cleveland Bus driver who defended himself and did what he felt he had to do. On September 18th he was confronted by a rude passenger who can clearly be seen verbally assaulting him. As described in the Police report she then allegedly spit on him as well. http://www.thesmokinggun.com/documents/clevelan...

  As someone who often rides public transit, I have personally seen what some of these drivers endure. It can be a high pressure job where the public can easily get on your nerves. Mr. Hughes was provoked by someone who was clearly a distraction. She was putting other passengers at risk. Now the driver has been suspended from his job because of it. I would never suggest hitting a woman. However as you can see by the video, he was pushed to far. Let's show our support and raise $5,000 for him. 
 
  Any portion of funds raised over that amount may be used to help raise safety awareness on public transit systems.

 

Camera angle 2

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GF4agwe1YLY&sns=tw

story:
Dual mode TriTrack is a 4-passenger EV with 5 cents per mile energy cost. It can be driven on the ground up to 70 mph and on an elevated monorail at 180 mph.

  • Do you hate wasting your precious time in traffic? 
  • Are you tired of spending money filling up your gas tank every week? 
  • Do you feel guilt over your personal contribution to climate change every time you get in your car?
  • Do you want to revolutionize personal transportation?
  • Do you want to end transport dependency on oil?
 

We have a solution: take Airplane Aerodynamics and Lightweight Design, add Moving repulsive magnetic fields and throw in advances in the Electric Battery logistics and you get the TriTrack - the cleanest, safest and most efficient vehicle on the planet. We also decided to make it Very Affordable, so your family can own one without any financial stress. Our reason for starting this project is simple: there is no low-cost electrical vehicle on the market that can change the way we move, dramatically saving lives, time, money, energy and making our planet cleaner.

 

What's a TriTrack?

The patented dual mode TriTrack is a 4-passenger electric car with plenty of cargo space which can be driven both on the ground and on an elevated monorail. Its speed on the ground is up to 70 mph. On the monorail TriTrack travels at a breathtaking 180 mph. It fits the legal description of a 3-wheel motorcycle in all 50 states, so it can be driven on the road like any other vehicle. In some states the TriTrack can also be recognized as a Neighborhood Electric Vehicle (NEV) with a software change. 

TriTrack is introducing structural composite system: light-weight, impact resistant, cost reducing and efficient. It uses our structural composites technology to redefine what you expect from a car. We would love to claim TriTrack is the first car with a composite body, but we would upset a lot of European exotic car makers. 

What we can say is that we are the first to bring this ground-breaking technology to the masses. Unlike the uber exotics, we don't use high-cost raw materials. Our processes allow us to utilize materials that are more readily available (thus less expensive) while still delivering incredible strength and light weight characteristics.

When you're in a TriTrack and a half-million-dollar supercar pulls alongside, you'll know your car is sporting the same advanced technology without the advanced price tag. Gloating is permissible.

 

The specs

Power Source

  • Solar panels installed on the TriTrack custom kit built garage and the monorail
  • Battery mule - 10 hp electric motor to drive on the road 
  • Vehicle - 80.5 hp electric motor to drive on the monorail
  • Up-ramp - 230 hp linear motor with magnetic linkage to the car to accelerate on the monorail
  • Down-ramp - 230 hp linear generator with magnetic linkage to the car to recover energy getting off the monorail
  • 18.7kWh mule lithium iron phosphate battery per mule

Body/Frame

  • Windshield  - Lexan TM (the same as private jets windshields) 
  • Body - Honeycomb sandwich monocoque (the same as used for an airplane body) 
  • LED lighting including headlights, brake lights, markers, cabin, map and turn signals
  • Alloy wheels front and rear option
  • Dynamic brakes rear and disk brakes front wheels
  • Curb weight street version 1,300 lbs
  • Storage compartment with room for 5 suitcases - 125lbs cargo

Performance

  • 180 mph (290 km/h) on the monorail
  • 70 mph (112 km/h) on the road
  • 205 miles (330km) range at hgighway speed with each battery mule (we will increase that by optimizing the battery manufacturing process)

 

How Does it Work?

On the ground, the TriTrack is powered by a battery mule stored underside of the car. When it gets on the monorail, the battery mule drops out of the TriTrack and a linear motor built into the monorail accelerates the car to cruising speed. A smaller battery inside the car maintains its speed on the monorail  and a linear generator recaptures the car's energy as it comes down off the rail. When the car reaches the ground again, it picks up a different, fully charged battery mule and continues to its final destination.

Who are you?

MaglevTrans is a team of like-minded people driven by the desire to revolutionize the transport industry and make our world better - a much cleaner and safer place to live in. The electric car is the step in the right direction, but it does not solve traffic problems, so we designed the solution for the transportation industry using Magnetic Levitation technology and TriTrack is the first part of this solution.

TriTrack is one of 19 patented ideas that Jerry Roane registered. Jerry has been involved in start-up companies since college.  Many of the projects that he has worked on have made it to the mainstream. The transmission that is like the one in the Toyota Prius that accounts for the high mileage on the highway was his first start-up out of college.  The continuously variable transmission with computer control was 25 years ahead of its time. The computerized credit card that is built into our American Express card was built first in the US by the factory that Jerry managed the construction of as a manufacturing engineering manager.  Jerry designed electronic packaging for the world’s thinnest production heart pacemaker of its time - the 8mm Quantum pacemaker. Now Jerry joined forces with the team from MagLevTrans and we are very close to finalizing creation of the new mode of transportation. Be part of this revolution in transportation.

 

Where we're at

We have a full engineering design completed, did testing in the University of Texas Wind Tunnel:

We then started building the first TriTrack. The picture you see below is a mold of the body shell of the first TriTrack.

We also ordered a lot of parts for the first 50 vehicles:

With your support, we can bring TriTrack into all cities worldwide. While we're close to entering production (we have got quotes for all components and ready to start), your contribution will help fund the completion of the prototype, do extensive testing and fine tuning. Following that we can start production tooling and the first production batch. Ultimately we want to establish a full highly automated production facility in the US to build TriTrack for every family.

Why Are You Doing a Indiegogo?

A few reasons.  First and foremost, we want to build a community around this project. We think Indiegogo is a great way to find interested people, to gather support and to get feedback.  

We also want help from the community in bringing the price of TriTrack as low as possible - to be the cheapest car you can find on the US market. We can only achieve that by creating tooling for mass production after vigorous testing of initial prototype vehicles.

We have invested a lot of our personal money and have serious investors who are prepared to invest. However, when you are as passionate about your ideals as you are about your product, finding investors who share the whole vision (not just the profits) can be tricky. When we started talking about Indiegogo, we were motivated and excited by the spirit of the community. We want to create vehicles that make the world better for everyone, from the rider whose time is very precious, to the worker who gets a new job building something sustainable, to the city dwellers who breathe a little easier with less pollution in the air. We feel that since getting these vehicles out in the world can have such a big impact on everyone, why not give everyone the opportunity to support the idea and help make it happen. We want to make these vehicles affordable and accessible for all people around the world, starting from US, and funding the first TriTrack through Indiegogo will help us achieve that goal.

By launching this project through Indiegogo, we hope we can get a head-start on all of these things. TriTrack has a lot to offer mankind in energy savings, cleaner air and time given back to families each day.

We Know We Can Do This! 

Designing and building a new class of vehicle from the ground up is extremely challenging. As a team, we have already encountered and conquered numerous bumps on the road, so we can say with confidence that we are ready and able to take on whatever obstacles that may lay ahead. 

We have completed the full engineering manufacturable designs and production quotes:

a lot of research and calculations:

and extensive testing:

We even changed legislation in Texas to include TriTrack monorail:

 

Ideas behind TriTrack – Safety, Convenience, Efficiency

Safety has been one of the top priorities while developing the TriTrack. The TriTrack car is very lightweight. Unloaded and without the battery mule, it will weigh approximately 300 lbs. Fully loaded and on the ground it will still be weigh less than 1,500 lbs. What this means for safety is that if you hit a pedestrian or other car, the likelihood of injuring them is greatly reduced. The reason why we can keep the TriTrack so lightweight compared to traditional cars is that it is built like an airplane. The strength of the structure is in the outer honeycomb shell rather than in a heavy steel frame. New technologies are worthless if they don't protect what’s most important. That's why safety is the most important part of the efficient vehicle design. Our impact resistant composite safety cage, which acts like a cocoon around passengers, is at the core of every TriTrack. Additionally, TriTrack composites are strong and tough, so they are less likely to crush during impact. In fact, our composites distribute the force across the body instead of bending like steel during an accident.

Convenience is another major priority for the TriTrack. It is all well and good to design an extremely safe car, but if it is too impractical or inconvenient, then nobody will drive it and it doesn't help anything. The problem with current (even electric) cars is that they have to share the same road. Nobody likes sitting in traffic, and who wants to add time to their daily commute? When on the monorail, the TriTrack can move at a much faster pace. Ideally, from anywhere in the city, you will be no more than a half mile from the nearest monorail ramp. This ensures that the majority of your travel is on the high-speed monorail and you're not stuck in traffic on the ground. Another inconvenience is having to stop to re-fuel or recharge. This is a major drawback of most clean-powered cars available today because it limits the cars' range. Because the distance a TriTrack travels on the ground is relatively short and because you always pick up a fresh battery mule when you get off the monorail or make a turn inthe city-wide grid, you have through logistics infinite range within the network and never have to stop to re-fuel. The smaller battery that is used to maintain speed on the monorail is quickly charged on the fly by the battery mule, so you don't have to stop to recharge it either. When a car is designed to hold a full day's (or week's) worth of power, it requires an incredibly large and expensive battery pack. The car's structure then must be stronger to support it, and thus heavier. A heavy car is not as energy efficient when it comes to moving people, and so range and performance are dropped, and it costs much more to replace the batteries. Due to recent developments in electric batteries we were able to design TriTrack with travelling distance of up to 205 miles, which is sufficient to travel anywhere in the city even without monorail. Thanks to installation of nation wide network of supercharging rolling swap stations (Patents 6,9239124 -- 7,127,999 -- 7,334,524) soon you will be able to travel across the states like in traditional gasoline car.

Efficiency: Finally, the solution has to be efficient and feasible. It is very important for the transportation revolution to happen as soon as possible. We've been promised flying cars and non-polluting vehicles for such a long time that people don't really believe it anymore. Everybody agrees that air pollution is a major problem, that traffic keeps getting worse, and that fossil fuels won't last much longer or still remain affordable. A car that can solve these problems and more sounds like a dream solution. Help make it a reality with TriTrack. 

The TriTrack dual mode, ultra-light, high-speed, monorail electric car will revolutionize both personal and shipping transportation. Be part of it by providing your support.

Dynamic brakes rear and disk brakes front wheels
Curb weight street version 1,300 lbs
Storage compartment with room for 5 suitcases - 125lbs cargo


Performance

180 mph (290 km/h) on the monorail
70 mph (112 km/h) on the road
205 miles (330km) range at hgighway speed with each battery mule (we will increase that by optimizing the battery manufacturing process)

 
How Does it Work?
On the ground, the TriTrack is powered by a battery mule stored underside of the car. When it gets on the monorail, the battery mule drops out of the TriTrack and a linear motor built into the monorail accelerates the car to cruising speed. A smaller battery inside the car maintains its speed on the monorail  and a linear generator recaptures the car's energy as it comes down off the rail. When the car reaches the ground again, it picks up a different, fully charged battery mule and continues to its final destination.

Who are you?
MaglevTrans is a team of like-minded people driven by the desire to revolutionize the transport industry and make our world better - a much cleaner and safer place to live in. The electric car is the step in the right direction, but it does not solve traffic problems, so we designed the solution for the transportation industry using Magnetic Levitation technology and TriTrack is the first part of this solution.
TriTrack is one of 19 patented ideas that Jerry Roane registered. Jerry has been involved in start-up companies since college.  Many of the projects that he has worked on have made it to the mainstream. The transmission that is like the one in the Toyota Prius that accounts for the high mileage on the highway was his first start-up out of college.  The continuously variable transmission with computer control was 25 years ahead of its time. The computerized credit card that is built into our American Express card was built first in the US by the factory that Jerry managed the construction of as a manufacturing engineering manager.  Jerry designed electronic packaging for the world’s thinnest production heart pacemaker of its time - the 8mm Quantum pacemaker. Now Jerry joined forces with the team from MagLevTrans and we are very close to finalizing creation of the new mode of transportation. Be part of this revolution in transportation.
 
Where we're at
We have a full engineering design completed, did testing in the University of Texas Wind Tunnel:

We then started building the first TriTrack. The picture you see below is a mold of the body shell of the first TriTrack.

We also ordered a lot of parts for the first 50 vehicles:



With your support, we can bring TriTrack into all cities worldwide. While we're close to entering production (we have got quotes for all components and ready to start), your contribution will help fund the completion of the prototype, do extensive testing and fine tuning. Following that we can start production tooling and the first production batch. Ultimately we want to establish a full highly automated production facility in the US to build TriTrack for every family.
Why Are You Doing a Indiegogo?
A few reasons.  First and foremost, we want to build a community around this project. We think Indiegogo is a great way to find interested people, to gather support and to get feedback.  
We also want help from the community in bringing the price of TriTrack as low as possible - to be the cheapest car you can find on the US market. We can only achieve that by creating tooling for mass production after vigorous testing of initial prototype vehicles.

We have invested a lot of our personal money and have serious investors who are prepared to invest. However, when you are as passionate about your ideals as you are about your product, finding investors who share the whole vision (not just the profits) can be tricky. When we started talking about Indiegogo, we were motivated and excited by the spirit of the community. We want to create vehicles that make the world better for everyone, from the rider whose time is very precious, to the worker who gets a new job building something sustainable, to the city dwellers who breathe a little easier with less pollution in the air. We feel that since getting these vehicles out in the world can have such a big impact on everyone, why not give everyone the opportunity to support the idea and help make it happen. We want to make these vehicles affordable and accessible for all people around the world, starting from US, and funding the first TriTrack through Indiegogo will help us achieve that goal.
By launching this project through Indiegogo, we hope we can get a head-start on all of these things. TriTrack has a lot to offer mankind in energy savings, cleaner air and time given back to families each day.
We Know We Can Do This! 
Designing and building a new class of vehicle from the ground up is extremely challenging. As a team, we have already encountered and conquered numerous bumps on the road, so we can say with confidence that we are ready and able to take on whatever obstacles that may lay ahead. 
We have completed the full engineering manufacturable designs and production quotes:

a lot of research and calculations:


and extensive testing:

We even changed legislation in Texas to include TriTrack monorail:

 
Ideas behind TriTrack – Safety, Convenience, Efficiency
Safety has been one of the top priorities while developing the TriTrack. The TriTrack car is very lightweight. Unloaded and without the battery mule, it will weigh approximately 300 lbs. Fully loaded and on the ground it will still be weigh less than 1,500 lbs. What this means for safety is that if you hit a pedestrian or other car, the likelihood of injuring them is greatly reduced. The reason why we can keep the TriTrack so lightweight compared to traditional cars is that it is built like an airplane. The strength of the structure is in the outer honeycomb shell rather than in a heavy steel frame. New technologies are worthless if they don't protect what’s most important. That's why safety is the most important part of the efficient vehicle design. Our impact resistant composite safety cage, which acts like a cocoon around passengers, is at the core of every TriTrack. Additionally, TriTrack composites are strong and tough, so they are less likely to crush during impact. In fact, our composites distribute the force across the body instead of bending like steel during an accident.
Convenience is another major priority for the TriTrack. It is all well and good to design an extremely safe car, but if it is too impractical or inconvenient, then nobody will drive it and it doesn't help anything. The problem with current (even electric) cars is that they have to share the same road. Nobody likes sitting in traffic, and who wants to add time to their daily commute? When on the monorail, the TriTrack can move at a much faster pace. Ideally, from anywhere in the city, you will be no more than a half mile from the nearest monorail ramp. This ensures that the majority of your travel is on the high-speed monorail and you're not stuck in traffic on the ground. Another inconvenience is having to stop to re-fuel or recharge. This is a major drawback of most clean-powered cars available today because it limits the cars' range. Because the distance a TriTrack travels on the ground is relatively short and because you always pick up a fresh battery mule when you get off the monorail or make a turn inthe city-wide grid, you have through logistics infinite range within the network and never have to stop to re-fuel. The smaller battery that is used to maintain speed on the monorail is quickly charged on the fly by the battery mule, so you don't have to stop to recharge it either. When a car is designed to hold a full day's (or week's) worth of power, it requires an incredibly large and expensive battery pack. The car's structure then must be stronger to support it, and thus heavier. A heavy car is not as energy efficient when it comes to moving people, and so range and performance are dropped, and it costs much more to replace the batteries. Due to recent developments in electric batteries we were able to design TriTrack with travelling distance of up to 205 miles, which is sufficient to travel anywhere in the city even without monorail. Thanks to installation of nation wide network of supercharging rolling swap stations (Patents 6,9239124 -- 7,127,999 -- 7,334,524) soon you will be able to travel across the states like in traditional gasoline car.

Efficiency: Finally, the solution has to be efficient and feasible. It is very important for the transportation revolution to happen as soon as possible. We've been promised flying cars and non-polluting vehicles for such a long time that people don't really believe it anymore. Everybody agrees that air pollution is a major problem, that traffic keeps getting worse, and that fossil fuels won't last much longer or still remain affordable. A car that can solve these problems and more sounds like a dream solution. Help make it a reality with TriTrack. 
The TriTrack dual mode, ultra-light, high-speed, monorail electric car will revolutionize both personal and shipping transportation. Be part of it by providing your support.

story:
Born in the Swiss urban jungle

Our customers have been asking to take our bikes home, now they can and so can you. 

 

BOND Mobility was born with the vision to transform societies and how cities move today. We challenge the conventional and provide more options to create the cities we aim to see in the future. 

The BOND Brava has 45 km/h assistance, long range construction.

Developed by BOND Mobility for the urban sharing market, BOND Brava is now available for you to own. It’s all about the details: we took all that we learned about making a robust urban shared eBike and refined it for personal ownership.

And that is the reason for this campaign; to start producing the eBike for personal usage.

 

The best from Switzerland just got brighter.
 

Started in 2016 as the world’s first free-floating eBike sharing platform, we’ve been improving the product and experience ever since. Based in Zurich, we developed an eBike that can handle the long and medium distance to commute, with a powerful motor providing instant torque to keep up with traffic off the line. We have the high range and strong components for daily use. We even add our trademark basket that accommodates a carry-on bag for those trips to the airport.

 

Delivery guaranteed

 

Your contribution is a guaranteed purchase. That means, if you order a BOND ebike now, you will 100% get the bike. 

 

 

Product specs:

  • Frame: Welded aluminium
  • Motor: SYNO Drive 800 Watt 45km/h, high torque
  • Display: TFT LCD Display / Speedometer positioned high to facilitate reading 
  • Battery: Removable with keylock, 840Wh, sufficient for up to 80 km 
  • Tires: Schwalbe Big Ben 26 inch wide tires 
  • Brakes: 2x Tektro hydraulic disc brakes 180mm
  • Gears: Shimano, Nine gears
  • Crank: Lasco 1x9, 52T 170mm
  • Light: Super bright Roxim in front, integrated brake rear
  • Rack: Black matt, max. load 30kg
     

Also integrated:

  • ​Horn and mirror for more safety
  • Universal smartphone holder
  • Communications, location tracking, theft proof
  • Smartphone unlock with separate power source
  • Protected cables designed for high wear
  • Soft comfort grips

 

Get your BOND Brava now and join us on our mission to lead the way towards more livable, healthy and connected cities.

 


What our customers say about the BOND Brava:

 
"The BOND shared ebikes are the most convenient option to move around in Zurich; it’s definitely fast and allows me to skip traffic easily."
- Tamara M., Munich 


"It’s so easy to unlock them, no need for additional keys or even my wallet anymore. I have everything I need just using the app on my phone."
- David W., London 


"I feel safer than with a normal bike – it’s so easy to go with the flow of the car traffic in the city."
- Emma T., Brussels

"I use the shared eBike in Zurich and I love it. I can rely on it and it has never let me down so far."
- Mladen D., Zurich

"Thanks to you, I have an additional way of moving around the city Now I commute to work with BOND. For me the dream has come true. Thank you very much."
- Felix R., Zurich
 


No other eBikes benefit from our experience in field operation and none are faster.

 

Tens of thousands of kilometers of on-street use and outdoor-only parking.

 


Brushed aluminum frame with surface treatment, contrasting black fenders, saddle and battery, crank and motor housing
 


 

Take your chance before it's too late!

story:
With Fiboard, you get the most advanced electric skateboard at the most affordable price.

Fiboard is the first and only affordable carbon fiber electric skateboard handmade by T700, 12k Carbon Fiber, which is equivalent to Aerospace Grade Carbon Fiber (Small Tow Carbon Fiber) with the streamline design, increasing speed and ease of movement. 


 

All your max speeds, max distances, and current ETA, all at a glance.

Fiboard electric skateboard is IPX5 waterproof rated so you can ride with all weather conditions with ease.

 

With our quick-charge, swappable battery that doubles as a power bank, your rides are limitless.

*Fiboard Swappable Battery Doubles As Power Bank Demo

 

Choose from 3 riding modes with up to 6 riding speeds to suite your style. From beginner to advanced, and everything in between.

 

Grab the ergonomic, 2.4G wireless remote to power your ride instantly.

 

 

Fiboard Review by Amateur Skateboarder Kevin

 

 

Connect to the free enSkate app for iOS and Android for the best ride possible.

Fiboard by enSkate - Rider Carves Through Park (Demo)

Fiboard by enSkate - Real Time Rider Data via Digital Dash (Demo)

 

Want to see more demo videos? Visit Fiboard YouTube channel for more 

Fiboard is incredibly easy to set up and even more fun to ride.

What you get with your pre-order.

 

enSkate is built from a stacked team with members coming from Gopro, Foxconn, and TCL Global Innovation Center. The team is composed of experienced engineers and consumer experience professionals. They are incredibly excited to finally bring you Fiboard.

Fiboard is in production. Orders are on track to start shipping November 2017.

We are able to ship worldwide. VAT and GST not included. Please see reward details for the shipping cost that applies to you.

We plan to ship the product in November/ December 2017*. We will keep you up to date on our progress and the expected delivery date of your order.

*Actual ship dates may vary. We will keep you notified of your product ship date.

​

By backing now you'll get to own one of the very first Fiboard by enSkate off the line plus exclusive access to prices never to be seen again.

 

 

Hit one of the buttons below and tag a friend or coworker who needs this!

 

 

What is it? Fiboard is the first and only affordable fully carbon fiber eBoard with Digital Dash showing board/ride data, a swappable power supply for increased riding range, and a battery that doubles as an on-the-go power bank.
Who created it? enSkate Inc. is comprised of an innovative group of skateboard enthusiasts and engineering specialists. We love marrying fun with tech.
Why should we use it? Fiboard's carbon fiber structure makes for a sleeker, lighter, and stronger board. Our swappable, high-capacity battery means you'll be spending less time charging and more time riding. Add some speed to your commute or some power to your joyride. 
How much does it cost? Fiboard will sell at a MSRP of $1288, but we are offering our first supporters an exclusive Indiegogo super early bird discount of $772 at 40% off.
Where can we buy it? Indiegogo
What do we get when we order?
  • Fiboard Electric skateboard 
  • Charger with Detachable Cord
  • Bluetooth Remote Control
  • Removable Wrist Strap
  • Micro USB Cable
  • Battery
  • User's Manual
  • Fiboard skate tool
Why are you crowdfunding? We are crowdfunding to see if skaters and eBoard enthusiasts would be as excited about our ideas for Fiboard as we are. We want to offer eSkaters a new and powerful solution at a price that doesn't hurt their wallets.

 

What features are available?
  • Total Carbon Fiber Body
  • Swappable Battery (20pcs LG battery inside)
  • Digital Dash
  • 6 Riding Modes (with Beginner Mode)
  • Cruise Control
  • LED Lights (Headlights/Brakelights)
  • Customizable Riding App
  • Tread Pattern
  • USB Power Bank
  • Quick Charge Time
  • Specs (mph, range, incline）
  • Bluetooth Enabled  Remote
  • Water Resistant（IPX5）
  • Powerful Dual In-wheel Drivetrain
  • Emergency Brake
What colors do you offer? Black                                                                                                             

 

What is the battery life? Hours of continuous use? How to charge?

Fiboard’s battery has an average life of 3 years (around 1000 charging times), 15.5 miles range (4 hours of continuous use), and charges in less than 3 hours.
There are two options for battery charging, according to your needs.

1. Integral Charging: Put the battery in the corresponding position on the skateboard, make sure the battery connector is in good contact, and connect the standard AC terminal to the 100-240VAC socket. Make sure the DC part is connected to the corresponding charging port position of the skateboard. The charger light will turn from green to red, indicating that the connection is normal and charging.
2. Split-type charging: Remove the battery from the inside of the skateboard and connect the charger and the corresponding interface of the battery through the battery charging switch. The charger light will turn from green to red (normal and charging) until the charger indicator light goes back to green from red, signifying the battery charge is completed. Unplug all the plugs and put in a safe place.
What are the dimensions and weight? 31in * 7in * 5in, the weight is 14.5lbs.
How does it work? Step 1: Turn on the remote control and Fiboard
Step 2: Connect Bluetooth remote with Fiboard through 2.4G wireless
Step 3: Enjoy Fiboard (Download enSkate app for more functions)
Will there be updates to it in the future? Yes, we plan on gradually adding updates to Fiboard in the future based on customer feedback.
How does it integrate with other connected devices?  Connect with mobile app via bluetooth.
Is it waterproof?

IPX5
Where is it manufactured? Made in China

 

Does it have an app? Which phones does it work with? Yes, IOS and Android
When will the app be available? Right now
Will there be updates available through the app? Yes, we will be providing regular updates to the app.                              

 

What are the recommend ages? 16-45
Where can I use it? Anywhere you want
What certifications do you have? UL2722 & FCC CE
Are there any risks associated with use? No                                                                                                                         

 

When does shipping begin? End of November  2017
When can we expect it to reach our doorsteps? December 2017
Where does it ship? From US and Mainland 
How much is shipping? Free shipping to US, Canada, and China. International shipping cost applies. 
I'm interested in a distribution partnership For distributor interests, contact us at sales08@enskate.com
Do I have to pay VAT / GST?

Consumers are only responsible for the consumption tax. enSkate will have Fiboard delivered to US warehouse and finish the packaging, then have it ship to consumers in short time.

 

Is there a warranty? One year for the skateboard, half year for the battery & motor, 
What is your refund policy? Refunds are processed on a case-by-case basis; at some point we will need to lock refunds in order to go into production & shipment. We will not be able to refund orders once they've shipped. 
What is your refund policy during the Indiegogo campaign? See these steps on How to Request a Refund. During the Indiegogo campaign, you can process the refund at any time by contacting support@indiegogo.com or searching their help center. Refunds are processed on a case-by-case basis; at some point we will need to lock refunds in order to go into production & shipment. We will not be able to refund orders once they've shipped.
How do I choose more than one reward?  To get more than one perk, please make a new contribution for each perk.
How can I check the status of my pre-order? By pre-ordering through Indiegogo, you automatically have an account created. Log back into Indiegogo using the email you pre-ordered, to verify your information.
Why do I have to wait longer than usual?

This is not just pre-orders: You're helping to build the device, and we need to know how many to make before we can start production. This is the first of its kind, and you'll be glad you waited. We will send you updates while we work to produce the first batch.
If I have other questions, who should I contact?

For investment inquiries, please contact: sales08@enskate.com
For support inquiries, please contact: support@enskate.com
For press inquiries, please contact: marketing01@enskate.com

What is your refund policy during the Indiegogo campaign?
See these steps on How to Request a Refund. During the Indiegogo campaign, you can process the refund at any time by contacting support@indiegogo.com or searching their help center. Refunds are processed on a case-by-case basis; at some point we will need to lock refunds in order to go into production & shipment. We will not be able to refund orders once they've shipped.


How do I choose more than one reward? 
To get more than one perk, please make a new contribution for each perk.


How can I check the status of my pre-order?
By pre-ordering through Indiegogo, you automatically have an account created. Log back into Indiegogo using the email you pre-ordered, to verify your information.


Why do I have to wait longer than usual?
This is not just pre-orders: You're helping to build the device, and we need to know how many to make before we can start production. This is the first of its kind, and you'll be glad you waited. We will send you updates while we work to produce the first batch.


If I have other questions, who should I contact?
For investment inquiries, please contact: sales08@enskate.comFor support inquiries, please contact: support@enskate.comFor press inquiries, please contact: marketing01@enskate.com

story:
Amarok Racing was founded by partners Michael Uhlarik and Kevin O'Neil in the winter of 2010 with the aim of designing & building the lightest, best handling high performance electric racing motorcycle possible, to challenge existing electric motorcycle limitations. 

 

 

Using our combined 40+ years of experience as professionals in vehicle development, we started with a clean sheet design that grew around the largest and most limiting part of the motorcycle : the batteries.  From there, inspired by our passion for aeospace design and Canadian design icons like the AVRO Arrow, we constructed an all aluminum, stressed-skin monocoque that radically reduced weight, added stiffness and balanced the motorcycle like the very best gasoline powered bikes today.

 

 

The Mission

The real test starts with our unprecedented entry in the Pikes Peak International Hill Climb race, near Boulder Colorado this June 24 - 30th.  This is the second oldest motor race in the United States and a brutal 156 turn, 10,000 foot ascent up Pikes Peak, that tests the resolve of professional drivers and that pushes the performance the endurance limits of vehicles.  

The electric motorcycle record up the hill stands at just under 13 minutes, a feat that was done on a big gasoline-powered Suzuki that had been modified with electric power but as a consequence weighed over 250kgs!  

Our Amarok P1A weighs almost half that, and was designed without compromise to be electric from the start.  Together with trusted partner and advisor Greg Tracy, a man who has won the race 6 times on a motorcycle, we plan to beat that time and set a new record for an electric motorcycle.  

 

Our Challenge 

 

 

We are an entirely self-funded team made up of motorcycle industry pros, but this isn't our day job.  Based in Altantic Canada means that our race will take us nearly 7000 kms round trip.  Thats a lot of gas for our van (pictured above), roadside food and some lodging (we can't sleep in the van every night without risking our partnership).  

Money raised will offset the cost of transportation of the motorcycle, spare parts, tools and crew, plus airfare and accomodations for our racer and development rider from Toronto and Atlantic Canada to Colorado and back.

 

- gas for van ($1400)

- return arifare for racer ($800)

- return airfare for videographer ($800)

- accomodations for team of 5 x 10 days ($2400)

- food for team ($1200)

 

Extra funds will go towards manufacturing lighter parts for the bike, that will further increase our chances of success on the mountain.  

We need your support to help fund our attempt, the first for any Canadian built motorcycle, to get to Pikes Peak and proove Why Less is More.

 

 

 

Amarok Racing believes in the power of hand craftsmanship and human experience to overcome limited resources.  Thats how we designed an electric motorcycle with the same power-to-weight-ratio of leading gasoline-powered 600cc supersport bikes without resorting to exotic materials and without hundreds of thousands of dollars in development budget.

 

 

Supporters of Amarok Racing will be up close and personal as we continue to document our project with live updates, a special event video and opening our doors and desk drawers so that you can see how we make this happen.  

We aim to punch above our weight, literally and figuratively.  In the months since we announced our intentions Amarok has garnered tons of media attention all across the racing and alternative energy world, and going ahead we expect to validate our concept of lightweight efficiency.

Amarok Racing is international award winning motorcycle designer Michael Uhlarik, and life-long motor racing mechanical design technician Kevin O'Neil.  Together with a dozen or so close friends, colleagues and supporters, we have made this ground-up project happen, from idea to track test in two and half years.

Michael has cut his teeth as a senior designer for Yamaha Motor in Europe and Japan, penning machines like the MT-03, TZR and 2003 M1 MotoGP.  He has also worked for Aprilia, Derbi, Bombardier and others.  He teaches design at the Nova Scotia College of Art and writes about the motorcycle industry for Hell For Leather and Cycle Canada magazines.

Kevin has been mad about Formula One and motorcycles since his teen years, owned and wrenched a March 71B formula race car, worked as a Norton, Laverda and Ducati mechanic, built kit airplanes and designed and manufactured just about every mechanical part found on performance motor vehicles, including the P1, for the better part of three decades.  What Kevin can do with a lathe and hand tools has to be seen to be believed. 

 

Perks

Amarok swag, limited edition poster prints, original artwork, trackdays with us and corporate team sponsorship are all on the table.  We want to show you that we apprecitate you help, your support and your enthusiasm by offering value as well as excitement.  Our new clothing is being made in Halifax by local people so we can ensure quality and reliable delivery.

 

 

 

The Impact

Amarok Racing is entirely self-funded.  We are raising corporate sponsorship and have been supported by AGNI Motor, Dunlop tire, Pro 6 Cycle, iamphoto media, CZ Carrozzeria, as well as a small army of supporters.  We expect to secure a title sponsor soon to compete in TTXGP / E-Power world championship events, but Pikes Peak is going to be all on us.

Going forward Amarok wants to keep developing the P1 concept so that we can race full time in 2014 and eventually bring our lightweight electric performance motorcycles to market for you to enjoy.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what you see but don't want to put down money, then tell all your tell your friends and paste a link to our campaign, our Facebook page or one of our videos into you social media and pass on our message.

We are the first Canadian team to do compete internationally on a motorcycle designed and made in Canada since 1984 when Bombardier ceased manufacturing Can-Am bikes.  Spread the word and you help boost Canadian innovation in vehicle design and manufacturing.

Thank you,

 

Team Amarok Racing

story:
On October 22nd 2012, around 5pm, Kevins bycicle was stolen while locked and parked infront of 24 Hour Fitness.

Kevin has been a great friend to me over the years, and to many of you as well.  I have no idea if this will work, but wouldn't it be grand if we all pitched in just a little bit...but it all added up to a new bike for Kevin!?

Kevin rides in the AIDS LifeCycle, so his bycicle is a very special...life-saving...bycicle! I am setting our goal at $1,000.  This is about the cost of a good (used) bike (and new lock!).  Kevin had also just pumped about 500 bucks into his old bike to get it tricked out for this years ride.  So, if we exceed our goal a little, we can help pimp his new bike some!

I am setting Kevins boyfriend, Nicholas, as an admin for this campaign...so y'all know it's on the up and up.

Lets pitch in, and get Kevin peddlin' again, ASAP!  He needs to start training for this summers LifeCycle!

Love and Light,

Kyle
