E-Bike Warranty and After Market Support:

Xtreme Fat Bikes uses the best Cycling and E-Components made. We Warranty the Frame and Fork System for Three Years and all of our E-Components are plug and play. So, even after our Six Month Warranty we can Replace any part separately and never have to replace the whole unit. Our Hub Motors slide out of their Shell and can be replaced as well, without ever having to Re-Lace a new Hub.

Xtreme Fat Bikes uses the best Cycling and E-Components made. We Warranty the Frame and Fork System for Three Years and all of our E-Components are plug and play. So, even after our Six Month Warranty we can Replace any part separately and never have to replace the whole unit. Our Hub Motors slide out of their Shell and can be replaced as well, without ever having to Re-Lace a new Hub.

Frequently Asked Questions:

Why Doesn't Our Bike Have Shocks?

Installing shocks on a Fat Tire Bike offers no significant value. The Fat Tires behave like shocks due to the large volume of air they contain and will cushion your ride over rough terrain and obstacles.

Why is Xtreme E-Bike the Only “REAL” Fat Tire E-Bike?

Fat Tire Electric Bikes with Rear Wheel Motors are really not true Fat Tire E-Bikes they are really just Electric Bikes with Fat Tires and are limited to cycling on streets and hard terrain.

Here’s why:

The Rear Wheel Drive E-Bike’s front wheel will dig in and bog down in loose terrain, making it dangerous to ride. In addition, the E-Bike not drive over loose terrain and obstacles. Everyone in the auto industry will tell you Front Wheel Drive is preferred in snow and dirt and that All Wheel Drive is the most effective method for riding to places you cannot get to with Rear Wheel Drive. Our Xtreme E-Bike will allow you to cycle in any and all terrain. You will not get this with a Rear Wheel Fat Tire E-Bike. Instead all you get is an E-Bike with the look of a Fat Tire Bike!

Our Electric Bike is Front Wheel Drive. What Exactly Does This Mean? 

The Front Wheel Drive makes our Bike the only All-Terrain Electric Bike currently in production. The Xtreme E-Bike can take you anywhere. You can ride on sand, snow, mud, upstairs and over obstacles. No other E-Bike in today’s market will allow you to do anything except ride on streets and other hard surfaces. If you are someone who enjoys riding on the beach, in the snow, on trails as well as the street, than this is the best E-Bike for you.

What Makes Our Company Better and Able to Guarantee You Will Receive a Bike? 

We have already produced and sold close to 100 “Real” Fat Tire E-Bikes. Our Xtreme E-Bikes are not only being used for personal use but for commercial use as rental units at beach and ski resorts. What better way to tour the country side of a resort town than on a Fat Tire All Terrain E-Bike?

We have recently sold several E-Bikes to a company that conducts cavern tours at the Louisville Mega Cavern, a 100 acre set of caves system in Louisville, Kentucky.

In addition, we have received only positive feedback from everyone who has tested and ridden our E-Bikes. They all agree that Front Wheel Drive combined with peddling power allows them much more freedom to ride to places that they could not go with a Rear Wheel Drive E-Bike.

What is the Difference between the E-Cherokee and E-Grizzly? 

These are the exact same E-Bike. The E-Cherokee is all Camouflage; the E-Grizzly is Matte Black with Neon Yellow Rims. 

What is the Difference between the 1000 Watt and 1250 Watt E-Bike? 

Power is the only difference between our 1000 Watt and 1250 Watt Electric Bikes.

The 1250 Watt has more power which you can use to get a little more speed to about 25 - 30 MPH and climbing and riding over obstacles; the 1000 Watt will reach speeds of 22 - 25 MPH and while it cycles over obstacles, it does have less climbing power.

How Do You Get Maximum Speed from your E-Bike?

Check and make sure that none of your brake pads are rubbing the tires. Also, be sure that your tires are inflated to 28 Ibs.

How Do I get a correct reading from my Spedometer?

Spedometers measure speed based on the diameter of tires. Most are not calibrated to proper settings. Make sure it is set at 29.5 tire diameter to ensure proper readings.

How Far can you Travel on a Charged Battery?

Both the 1000 Watt and the 1250 Watt Electric Bike can go around 30 Miles on hard surface at top speed without any peddling. The distance will vary if you are on soft terrain or going up hills as that takes more power.

If you add peddling to your journey you can substantially increase the distance you can travel on a fully charged battery.

How Long Does it Take to Fully Charge the Battery?

A completely depleted battery takes approximately three hours to charge.

How Long Will the Battery Last?

The battery is rated to last 500 cycles. A cycle = depleting a battery then fully charging it 500 times. So how long the battery last depends on how much usage. Most batteries last a lot longer than 500 Cycles more like 1000-1500 Charges because, typically a battery is never completed depleted prior to charging.

What is Our Warranty with Our Electric Bikes?

We offer a one year manufacturer’s warranty on all parts except the battery which is warrantied for six months.

How Do We Let You Know What Size and Color E-Bike We Want?

Please indicate the model and style you wish when you select a perk.

How Can You Contact Us Once You Purchase Your E-Bike and After the IndieGoGo Campaign has Ended?

Visit our website at www.XtremeFatTireBikes.com where you can email us or Call us at: (757) 635-5160.

Meet The Xtreme Fat Tire Bike Team

The Xtreme Fat Tire Bike Team has recently partnered with the Miss GEICO Racing Team. The newly formed team compliments both the ingenuity of the Xtreme Fat Tire Bike Design with the renown safety and quality standards of Miss GEICO Boat Racing.

Together they look forward to establishing a market foothold on the unlimited sporting potential of electric bikes, compact folding bikes for the mariner industry as well as racing components for extreme bike racing.


Thomas E Coghill Sr., Managing Member:

Thomas E. Coghill, Sr. graduated from the University of North Carolina in Chapel Hill, NC with a B.S. in Business Administration in 1954 and has owned and operated several diverse businesses. From 1965 to 1973, he was a stockbroker and investment adviser.

In 1973, he formed his own commercial real estate company. He has been involved in the sale and/or ownership of almost $300 million dollars of successful rental apartment projects since that time. He has been involved in the ownership and development of revolutionary fat tire bicycles since 2008. Tom Coghill has ridden in or promoted charity bicycle rides and has personally raised in excess of $250,000 for various charities including diabetes, cancer, hospice services and leukemia and lymphoma.

During the Holiday Season of 2016, Mr. Coghill donated over $5000 in Fat Tire Children's Bikes to a selected group of children with special needs. He continues his charity work through his innovative business investments along with his recent partnership with the Miss GEICO Race Team.


Marc Granet

Position: Partner / Driver Marc Granet, Driver, pilots Miss GEICO, the fastest offshore racing catamaran in the world and is an eight time World Champion. Like most offshore powerboat racers, he started in a v-bottom performance boat until a friend took him for a ride in a catamaran boat. "We hit about 90 mph and that was it for me and v-bottoms," Granet recalled. Marc spent several years in the American Power Boat Association/Super Boat International racing circuit earning the respect of his competitors before Miss GEICO came calling in 2004. Soon, Granet found himself settled into the cockpit of Miss GEICO whose turbine engines cranked out 3700 horsepower and the boat reached speeds unheard of in the sport of offshore racing. With Miss GEICO, Granet and Throttleman, Scott Begovich, hold numerous speed records and world titles. In 2016 Granet and Begovich look forward to steering Miss GEICO to winning another National title in Clearwater and the coveted World Title in Key West. Competition from all over the world will be tough and Miss GEICO looks forward to the challenge.


Gary Stray

Position: Partner / Crew Chief World renowned master rigger, Gary Stray, joined the Miss GEICO team in 2009 and made an immediate impact in helping guide the team to another convincing World Championship victory. Gary began his career in the racing business in Southampton, England in 1988 with Cougar Marine. In 1994 he signed on with the Victory Team of Dubai rising to the head of Research & Development and ten world titles later, he set up his own rigging company in the United States. Gary established Supercat Rigging, Inc. in 2001 and his boats have won multiple championships and set numerous speed records. He has also created some of the most prestigious pleasure craft in the world today such as Speed Racer, Batman, Mercedes, Ferrari and Corvette. Miss GEICO was in the right place and time to land Gary Stray. "Each year we have to continue to improve because our competitors are introducing newer lighter boats with greater horsepower in an effort to take away our World crown and we simply will not allow it to happen."


Scott Colton:

Partner / Managing Member Scott Colton is the Managing Member of the Miss GEICO Race Team. Scott is a Floridian and former All American swimmer. With his law and MBA degrees from the University of Florida, Scott brings over twenty five years of legal and business experience to the Miss GEICO Racing Team.

Scott Colton has been involved with all the team's affairs since the inception of Miss GEICO Racing and focuses his attention on the technical, legal, and financial side of the business making sure that all of the trucks, trailers, and fleet of boats are in compliance with federal, state, and local laws; scheduling and coordinating the movement of the equipment and people to the Boat Shows, Boat Races, Air Shows, and charitable events while handling the finances so that the employees, independent contractors, and sponsors remain pleased with Miss GEICO Racing. He also never fails to remind Marc and Scotty to be safe and careful while they are out on the race boat. "We are very fortunate to have such a wonderful sponsor in GEICO and we spend our time focusing on safety, professionalism, winning titles, and promoting our sponsor to the best of our abilities."

Pre-Order Our 1000 or 1250 Watt Powerful Full Size E-Bike or Super-Compact, Folding Bike with Front Wheel / All Wheel Drive System available only through IndieGoGo!Athletic Investments, LLC doing business as Xtreme Fat Tire Bikes has teamed up with 8-time World Speed Boat Title Holders and the Multiple World Record Setting Team of Miss GEICO Racing.With GEICO's expertise in engineering, safety and quality control and Xtreme's innovative fat tire bicycle designs, we are proud to present some of our very best Fat Tire Electric Bicycles.Our E-Bikes feature our patented Front Hub Motor Electrical System paired with a rear Shimano 8 Speed Design that provides riders with the benefits of front wheel / all wheel drive, (when adding pedal power). The result is the only truly safe Fat Tire Electric Bike with all wheel drive.Choose from 1000 watt or 1250 watt, 48 Volt systems that will safely power you through any terrain and over any obstacle with out the potential danger of flying over the handle bars common in rear wheel powered e-bikes.Need to Finance Your Contribution?Click here to learn how to Finance Your Folding Electric BikeWe offer two models of e-bikes: Full Size Model: (As seen in Campaign Video)Our fat tire full size model is available in three sizes; Medium - 17", Large - 19" or Extra Large - 21" frame with 26" wheel type and an extra wide 5" tire x 30" in diameter.Super Compact Folding Model:Our fat tire folding bike model; with 4" wide tires x 24" diameter. Both models are available in our Standard Matte Black with Neon Yellow Rims Style or a Sportsman Version, perfect for hunting and gaming, with Camouflage Frame and Camouflage Rims.In addition, we are offering a variety of interchangeable bike accessories from fenders, front gear racks for fishing and hunting gear or spring loaded back racks, even a golf bag boy puller attachment.We use  a Front Hub Motor that with combined with your own pedal power creates an All-Wheel Drive Fat Tire Electric Bike that safely powers through any terrain and over almost any obstacle. This E-Bike literally has no limits. You can now cycle upstairs, over logs, and over most any obstacle your bottom bracket can clear and even some it can’t. The All-Terrain System allows cycling on even the softest sand, snow, deep mud, and gravel. Check out our interchangeable bike accessories from front gear racks and spring loaded rear rack, fenders and even a golf bag holder for trekking around the golf course!About Our Electric Bikes:Our E-Bikes use a Front Hub Motor that with combined with your own pedal power creates an All-Wheel Drive Fat Tire Electric Bike that safely powers through any terrain and over almost any obstacle. This E-Bike literally has no limits.We offer a 1000 watt and 1250 watt option for you to choose from. You can now cycle upstairs, over logs, and over most any obstacle your bottom bracket can clear and even some it can’t. The All-Terrain System allows cycling on even the softest sand, snow, deep mud, and gravel. For a LIMITED TIME ONLY you can purchase our electric bikes from $1099 - $1199. A SAVINGS OF $600 from Regular Retail Price!Our Electric Bikes come in the Standard Style of Matte Black Frame and Neon Yellow Rims or our Sportsman Style of Camouflage Frame and Rims ideal for Hunting and Fishing. Check out our interchangeable bike accessories from front gear racks and spring loaded rear rack, fenders and even a golf bag boy puller attachment for trekking around the golf course!This Electric Bike is Literally  Unstoppable!!!!!Why Front Wheel Drive?Here's Why: By taking our ultimate Fat Bike and adding our Front Wheel Drive Electric System we feel we have designed a ONE OF A KIND E-Bike.Most Electric Bikes are either rear wheel drive mid - drive, rear system.  This puts all the torque on the rear and as anyone who has ever driven through soft terrain like sand, snow, mud or over obstacles like curbs, stairs or logs, would know front wheel drive torque performs better.With the motor in the front, you can go through any terrain. Also, with others rear torque systems, at top speed, in soft terrain, when you attempt to turn you easily could dig the wheel in and cause a dangerous situation.

Download Our Independent Engineering Report 
Download Our Geico Report
With our E-Bike, you just power through those turns. And by adding a little pedal power you have an ALL-WHEEL DRIVE  E-BIKE  that will cycle through any terrain and over it almost anything!Two Styles to Choose From:  Standard or SportsmanChoose from the sleek E-Grizzly with matte black frame and fork and yellow neon rims or are game stalker E-Cherokee with camouflage frame, fork and rims. Both electric bikes are available with a 1000 Watt, 48 Volt E-Bike system for speeds up to 25 mph or the 1250 Watt, 48 Volt E-Bike system with speeds up to 30 mph.
Why Ride a Fat Tire E-Bike?
If you are a commuter, looking to protect the environment, or just a person looking to save money on  gas, then this e bike is for you. You can easily get around town, avoid traffic jams and enjoy the outdoors on our Electric Bikes.
Other great uses for our fat E-Bikes are for hunters, or a rider looking to go places they have only been able to get to on foot before, or someone that’s just up for some xtreme riding.
Xtreme’s Fat E-Bikes will get you there!

What makes Xtreme’s eBike so much better than the rest?
Our Unique Safety Features:
Our Braking System:
We only use Avid Disc Rotors and Calipers and we use a 180mm rotor on both the Front and Rear for maximum stopping power.
Our eBike Motor:
Our motor only works with your thumb on the throttle; it shuts off automatically when you release it.
Our Tires:
Our Fat Tires are the widest width available which provides stability and superior stopping power.
Most other Fat Tire E-Bikes utilize either Center or Rear Wheel Drive Systems. This not only is a Safety Factor in Loose or Soft Terrain but, it also prohibits their ability to move through loose terrain or over obstacles.
The Rear Wheel Drive System is proven to turn poorly in Soft Terrain and can be hard to maneuver which can be dangerous at high speeds in soft terrain such as snow, grass or sand.
The Center Wheel Drive Systems can become unstable on uneven terrains and negotiating obstacles and have far more difficulty in climbing obstacles compared to the ALL-Wheel Drive System.
We have designed the first ever ALL-WHEEL Drive for SUPERIOR SAFETY and BEST for getting through most any terrain, and over obstacles!
Our Copyrighted and patented Skull Tire with its’ 5” width is made of Puncture-Resistant Rubber and is currently the WIDEST FAT TIRE being  manufactured. 


This tire is not only the coolest out there, but is very functional as well with its Center Bead.
You can Ride on only 10mm of tire when on hard surfaces and with 5” of width you have the widest tire made for soft terrain. This tire works with 5 PSI to 30 PSI, so it can be flattened out for very Soft Terrain and add pressure to 30 PSI for the road. This tire with its large air capacity acts just like a Shock for Jumps and Rough Terrain.
Electric Bike Battery:
Our batteries are made by Greenway, one of the top Battery Manufacturers is Asia. It uses a separate Water Bottle Mount that is not part of the battery like most other companies use and can be easily removed without having to take off any wires from the battery. This battery has a sealed shell that is completely Water Proof with its own built in voltage meter to tell if it needs a charge or not. Plus it has a neat carrying handle attached to it for Easy Removal  to carry for security or take with you to charge. Our 48 Volt system and uses only the best Lithium Ion Technology with Sony Cells.

Front Hub Electric Bike Motor:
Choose From:
1000 Watt or 1250 Watt with 48 Volts for the Xtreme Rider in You.
This allows you to have a Fat E-Bike that can take you literally anywhere!
Rear Wheel System:
Rear Wheel is a Quick Release Hub with a Shimano 11-36T Cassette and an 8-Speed Shimano Alivio / Altus Rear Derailleur.

Now add these two great features together and here’s what you get:
The only Fat Bike which is All-Wheel Drive on the Market. This Bike’s Drive System will literally take you anywhere, over most any object, even upstairs and over logs with ease.
In Addition:
Top Quality Sealed Bearings Components: Our E-Bikes are not only made for any Terrain but, also any environment with its sealed Bearing Head Set, Bottom Bracket, and Hubs making it completely weather resistant.
All Alloy Components: We use all alloy parts and frame for additional weather resistance.

Front Hub Motors and Electric Systems:
All of our motors are Brushless and our parts, as well as, our cord plugs are water resistant.

100mm Ultra- Light Alloy Rims , 26" by 100mm  with Cut-Outs
Schrader Valve, 36H

Rear Hub: Alloy Hub with Sealed Bearings and 8-Speed Cassette, Quick Release.
Tire: 24" by 4” width; Premium Kendra tires with high density rubber for puncture resistance with center bead.
Tubes: 24" x 4" Schrader valve.
Components:
Crank Set: Alloy 38T chain ring, Alloy crank with 175mm arm.
Chain: KMC Rust Buster.
BB Set: Steel shell, sealed bearings, 100mm shell width.
Shifter: Shimano 9-Speed Alivio
Rear Derailleur: Alivio 9-Speed
Seatpost: Alloy 27.2 mm, 350 mm length (black)
Seatpost Clamp: Alloy with Quick Release.
Weight and Packing:
Packing: 85% complete.
 
E-Bike Warranty and After Market Support:
Xtreme Fat Bikes uses the best Cycling and E-Components made. We Warranty the Frame and Fork System for Three Years and all of our E-Components are plug and play. So, even after our Six Month Warranty we can Replace any part separately and never have to replace the whole unit. Our Hub Motors slide out of their Shell and can be replaced as well, without ever having to Re-Lace a new Hub.
Xtreme Fat Bikes uses the best Cycling and E-Components made. We Warranty the Frame and Fork System for Three Years and all of our E-Components are plug and play. So, even after our Six Month Warranty we can Replace any part separately and never have to replace the whole unit. Our Hub Motors slide out of their Shell and can be replaced as well, without ever having to Re-Lace a new Hub.
Frequently Asked Questions:
Why Doesn't Our Bike Have Shocks?
Installing shocks on a Fat Tire Bike offers no significant value. The Fat Tires behave like shocks due to the large volume of air they contain and will cushion your ride over rough terrain and obstacles.
Why is Xtreme E-Bike the Only “REAL” Fat Tire E-Bike?
Fat Tire Electric Bikes with Rear Wheel Motors are really not true Fat Tire E-Bikes they are really just Electric Bikes with Fat Tires and are limited to cycling on streets and hard terrain.
Here’s why:
The Rear Wheel Drive E-Bike’s front wheel will dig in and bog down in loose terrain, making it dangerous to ride. In addition, the E-Bike not drive over loose terrain and obstacles. Everyone in the auto industry will tell you Front Wheel Drive is preferred in snow and dirt and that All Wheel Drive is the most effective method for riding to places you cannot get to with Rear Wheel Drive. Our Xtreme E-Bike will allow you to cycle in any and all terrain. You will not get this with a Rear Wheel Fat Tire E-Bike. Instead all you get is an E-Bike with the look of a Fat Tire Bike!
Our Electric Bike is Front Wheel Drive. What Exactly Does This Mean? 
The Front Wheel Drive makes our Bike the only All-Terrain Electric Bike currently in production. The Xtreme E-Bike can take you anywhere. You can ride on sand, snow, mud, upstairs and over obstacles. No other E-Bike in today’s market will allow you to do anything except ride on streets and other hard surfaces. If you are someone who enjoys riding on the beach, in the snow, on trails as well as the street, than this is the best E-Bike for you.
What Makes Our Company Better and Able to Guarantee You Will Receive a Bike? 
We have already produced and sold close to 100 “Real” Fat Tire E-Bikes. Our Xtreme E-Bikes are not only being used for personal use but for commercial use as rental units at beach and ski resorts. What better way to tour the country side of a resort town than on a Fat Tire All Terrain E-Bike?
We have recently sold several E-Bikes to a company that conducts cavern tours at the Louisville Mega Cavern, a 100 acre set of caves system in Louisville, Kentucky.
In addition, we have received only positive feedback from everyone who has tested and ridden our E-Bikes. They all agree that Front Wheel Drive combined with peddling power allows them much more freedom to ride to places that they could not go with a Rear Wheel Drive E-Bike.
What is the Difference between the E-Cherokee and E-Grizzly? 
These are the exact same E-Bike. The E-Cherokee is all Camouflage; the E-Grizzly is Matte Black with Neon Yellow Rims. 
What is the Difference between the 1000 Watt and 1250 Watt E-Bike? 
Power is the only difference between our 1000 Watt and 1250 Watt Electric Bikes.
The 1250 Watt has more power which you can use to get a little more speed to about 25 - 30 MPH and climbing and riding over obstacles; the 1000 Watt will reach speeds of 22 - 25 MPH and while it cycles over obstacles, it does have less climbing power.
How Do You Get Maximum Speed from your E-Bike?
Check and make sure that none of your brake pads are rubbing the tires. Also, be sure that your tires are inflated to 28 Ibs.
How Do I get a correct reading from my Spedometer?
Spedometers measure speed based on the diameter of tires. Most are not calibrated to proper settings. Make sure it is set at 29.5 tire diameter to ensure proper readings.
How Far can you Travel on a Charged Battery?
Both the 1000 Watt and the 1250 Watt Electric Bike can go around 30 Miles on hard surface at top speed without any peddling. The distance will vary if you are on soft terrain or going up hills as that takes more power.
If you add peddling to your journey you can substantially increase the distance you can travel on a fully charged battery.
How Long Does it Take to Fully Charge the Battery?
A completely depleted battery takes approximately three hours to charge.
How Long Will the Battery Last?
The battery is rated to last 500 cycles. A cycle = depleting a battery then fully charging it 500 times. So how long the battery last depends on how much usage. Most batteries last a lot longer than 500 Cycles more like 1000-1500 Charges because, typically a battery is never completed depleted prior to charging.
What is Our Warranty with Our Electric Bikes?
We offer a one year manufacturer’s warranty on all parts except the battery which is warrantied for six months.
How Do We Let You Know What Size and Color E-Bike We Want?Please indicate the model and style you wish when you select a perk.
How Can You Contact Us Once You Purchase Your E-Bike and After the IndieGoGo Campaign has Ended?
Visit our website at www.XtremeFatTireBikes.com where you can email us or Call us at: (757) 635-5160.
Meet The Xtreme Fat Tire Bike Team
The Xtreme Fat Tire Bike Team has recently partnered with the Miss GEICO Racing Team. The newly formed team compliments both the ingenuity of the Xtreme Fat Tire Bike Design with the renown safety and quality standards of Miss GEICO Boat Racing.
Together they look forward to establishing a market foothold on the unlimited sporting potential of electric bikes, compact folding bikes for the mariner industry as well as racing components for extreme bike racing.


Thomas E Coghill Sr., Managing Member:
Thomas E. Coghill, Sr. graduated from the University of North Carolina in Chapel Hill, NC with a B.S. in Business Administration in 1954 and has owned and operated several diverse businesses. From 1965 to 1973, he was a stockbroker and investment adviser.
In 1973, he formed his own commercial real estate company. He has been involved in the sale and/or ownership of almost $300 million dollars of successful rental apartment projects since that time. He has been involved in the ownership and development of revolutionary fat tire bicycles since 2008. Tom Coghill has ridden in or promoted charity bicycle rides and has personally raised in excess of $250,000 for various charities including diabetes, cancer, hospice services and leukemia and lymphoma.
During the Holiday Season of 2016, Mr. Coghill donated over $5000 in Fat Tire Children's Bikes to a selected group of children with special needs. He continues his charity work through his innovative business investments along with his recent partnership with the Miss GEICO Race Team.


Marc Granet
Position: Partner / Driver Marc Granet, Driver, pilots Miss GEICO, the fastest offshore racing catamaran in the world and is an eight time World Champion. Like most offshore powerboat racers, he started in a v-bottom performance boat until a friend took him for a ride in a catamaran boat. "We hit about 90 mph and that was it for me and v-bottoms," Granet recalled. Marc spent several years in the American Power Boat Association/Super Boat International racing circuit earning the respect of his competitors before Miss GEICO came calling in 2004. Soon, Granet found himself settled into the cockpit of Miss GEICO whose turbine engines cranked out 3700 horsepower and the boat reached speeds unheard of in the sport of offshore racing. With Miss GEICO, Granet and Throttleman, Scott Begovich, hold numerous speed records and world titles. In 2016 Granet and Begovich look forward to steering Miss GEICO to winning another National title in Clearwater and the coveted World Title in Key West. Competition from all over the world will be tough and Miss GEICO looks forward to the challenge.


Gary Stray
Position: Partner / Crew Chief World renowned master rigger, Gary Stray, joined the Miss GEICO team in 2009 and made an immediate impact in helping guide the team to another convincing World Championship victory. Gary began his career in the racing business in Southampton, England in 1988 with Cougar Marine. In 1994 he signed on with the Victory Team of Dubai rising to the head of Research & Development and ten world titles later, he set up his own rigging company in the United States. Gary established Supercat Rigging, Inc. in 2001 and his boats have won multiple championships and set numerous speed records. He has also created some of the most prestigious pleasure craft in the world today such as Speed Racer, Batman, Mercedes, Ferrari and Corvette. Miss GEICO was in the right place and time to land Gary Stray. "Each year we have to continue to improve because our competitors are introducing newer lighter boats with greater horsepower in an effort to take away our World crown and we simply will not allow it to happen."


Scott Colton:
Partner / Managing Member Scott Colton is the Managing Member of the Miss GEICO Race Team. Scott is a Floridian and former All American swimmer. With his law and MBA degrees from the University of Florida, Scott brings over twenty five years of legal and business experience to the Miss GEICO Racing Team.
Scott Colton has been involved with all the team's affairs since the inception of Miss GEICO Racing and focuses his attention on the technical, legal, and financial side of the business making sure that all of the trucks, trailers, and fleet of boats are in compliance with federal, state, and local laws; scheduling and coordinating the movement of the equipment and people to the Boat Shows, Boat Races, Air Shows, and charitable events while handling the finances so that the employees, independent contractors, and sponsors remain pleased with Miss GEICO Racing. He also never fails to remind Marc and Scotty to be safe and careful while they are out on the race boat. "We are very fortunate to have such a wonderful sponsor in GEICO and we spend our time focusing on safety, professionalism, winning titles, and promoting our sponsor to the best of our abilities."

story:
Hurry up! The first batch is ready this September!

Update: If you are in doubt which version to choose, the 402 version now includes an adapter which is compatible with all bicycles! No need to measure your handlebar anymore.

 

Meet N-Lock

N-Lock is a multipurpose bicycle lock for locking, parking, transportation and storage purposes – perfect for camping, bicycle, mountain bike and gadget entusiasts.

The lock is made from the best materials on the market and has been thoroughly tested even under different weather conditions. Our cable with a heavy wire adds even more security! 

- Have your ever had your bicycle bumping into and scratching your caravan or car during transportation?

- Maybe you are having trouble with parking your bicycle in crowded places?

- Perhaps you want to store your bicycle in your apartment? 

- Or maybe you are tired of thieves stealing your bicycle?

 

Compatible with All Bicycles!

N-Lock comes in two versions – 401 and 402. 
 

UPDATE! If you are in doubt which version to choose, the 402 version now includes an adapter which fits all bicycles! No need to measure your handlebar anymore!

All you need to do is measure your handlebar as shown in the picture above. Your bicycle needs either a 401 (if your handlebar measures 25.4mm/1 inch) or a 402 (if your handlebar measures 31.8mm/1,25 inches).
If you are in doubt you are more than welcome to contact us with any questions:
(+45) 41 40 30 30 or by mail.

 

 
 
 

Lock Your Bicycle

When the lock is activated, the handlebar can be rotated 90º (90º to right and 90º  to the left) without the front wheel following. 

N-Lock does not only protect bicycles against theft but also improves the way of storing and transporting your bicycle.

 

Park Your Bicycle

Do you ever have trouble parking in crowded spaces? N-Lock is the perfect solution for parking in cities crowded with bicycles.

When your bicycle needs to be parked, N-Lock allows the handlebar to be turned which reduces the space with up to 40%. N-Lock allows you to park anywhere  – making your everyday life much easier.

This feature also helps you if you are having trouble with transporting your bicycle in an overcrowded train or metro.

 

Store Your Bicycle

 

Do you want to bring home your bicycle but live in a small apartment? Maybe you want to store your bicycle in a small garage or repository? – N-Lock is the solution. 

A lot of people store their bicycle in their apartment to prevent the bicycle from being stolen. However, this takes up much space. With N-Lock turning the handlebar 90º without the wheel following, it is possible to store your bicycle in for instance the hallway.

 

Transport Your Bicycle

If you enjoy bringing your bicycle on an active vacation, N-Lock is a great solution to prevent dents and scratches. Simply install N-Lock on your bicycle – your bumps and scratches nightmare will be over.

Also, N-Lock makes it possible for you to transport several bicycles on your car or caravan due to the 40 % more space you will get when turning the handlebar 180º - 90º to the right and 90º  to the left.

 

Prevent Bicycle Theft

Your bicycle is safe and sound with N-Lock and the heavy wired cable you can add. Even if a thieve gets hold of your bicycle – the bicycle will be impossible to ride when locked!

With N-Lock mounted on your bicycle, your bicycle will be protected against theft. Even though a thieve might bring an allen key and a bolt cutter when seeking to steal a bicycle, with N-Lock mounted on your bicycle and our heavy wired cable, the thieve will not be able to use the bicycle. 
 
First and foremost, the cable is made of spring steel and the best materials available. If the thieve removes N-Lock with an allen key, the bicycle will be useless, since N-Lock is mounted on the stem of the handlebar. The thieve will end up with a handlebar seperated from the bicycle. The bicycle will be useless.

 

The Story Behind N-Lock

The idea behind N-Lock was born in 2014 when the inventor (an experienced bicycle-dealer, with a lot of issues with theft and transport) got his own bicycle stolen (with a prototype of the N-Lock mounted) and found it just a few meters away.

With this experience in mind he decided to develop N-Lock into something for every cyclist in the world.
It was not the first time the bicycle was stolen – but maybe the last.

Having pitched the idea to a couple of friends and checking the market for other solutions, they discovered that there was not any bicycle lock like N-Lock on the market. The guys joined forces and created the company Turn1 which is the holder of the patent for N-Lock.

We have spent over 8.000 hours to get the product ready for you. It takes around 10.000  hours to really understand what you’re doing .
We are getting close but we always trying to rethink how N-Lock can be improved.

The project was kicked off in 2014 and now we need your help to grow.
With your contribution, N-Lock can grow stronger and serve all of us far into the future. 

 

What We Need and What You Get

Our goal for our campaign 50.000$. When you back us you will receive your very own N-Lock with a favorable discount. 

We will start shipping in November! 

 

Risks and Challenges

We have been working on N-Lock since 2014 which means that we have had some time to upgrade, assemple and develop an innovative and unique lock for all cyclists. 

We have chosen the best materials on the market to make sure that your N-Lock is in tip-top condition when you receive it. 
We are confident that N-Lock is the right choice for all cyclists interested in a high-quality and multipurpose bicycle lock. 

We have already commenced the production of N-Lock in Taiwan and we will start shipping the locks in November. We are in constant contact with our production in Taiwan to make sure N-Lock is produced right and so that we do not run into any issues regarding the production.

We will update our backers with the process or if we have the misfortune to run into any problems.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to our campaign, we could still use your help! If you have fallen in love with N-Lock please help us to get the word out. One way is to use the Indiegogo share tools.

We would really appreciate you spreading the word about N-Lock – we truly believe N-Lock could help a lot of cyclists around the world. 

 

Like us on and follow us on social media!

story:
The Plan

Drawing inspiration from motorcyclists who rode cross country in the 1930's, I plan to rebuild a 1933 Harley-Davidson VL, ship it to the west coast and ride it back across the country on US Route 50.  I'll be joined by another rider on his 1934 Harley-Davidson VLD, but that will be the extent of my support crew.  There will not be any chase trucks or other support personnel.  We'll be left with just the tools/parts we can carry, our wits and hopefully a bit of luck.  I want to prove that these old motorcycles are still viable forms of transportation and should be ridden instead of gathering dust in museums or private collections. 

Why A 1933 Harley-Davidson VL?

Aesthetically, the 1933 VL is a stunning machine.  It still carries the lightweight look of an early motorcycle thanks to it's open rear fender and minimal options.  The iconic paint scheme was only available for the 1933 model year and is arguably the best that has every come out of Milwaukee.  The '33 also performs as good as it looks, which makes it well suited for this adventure.

The V-series went into production in 1930 to replace the F-head V-twins which had powered Harley's for almost 20 years.  This new side-valve powered motorcycle featured a number of modern improvements like an enclosed valve train, I-beam forged front forks, drop center rims, a duplex primary chain and many others.  All of these combine to make a highly dependable motorcycle, capable of crossing the US.

Besides dependability, the V-series is also relatively fast for an antique machine.  In 1933, the VLE model set an American production motorcycle speed record of 104 mph.  This made them popular with police forces and the following footage taken in 1935 demonstrates their ability to reach speeds over 100 mph. 

I don't plan on riding mine at those speeds, but this shows that a VL can handle speeds found on today's modern highways.  

Details

Work will officially begin on the VL at the end of November on Black Friday.  The first step is to prepare the engine for rebuilding.  Appropriate engine parts will be cleaned, bead blasted and painted per original factory specifications.  All threaded holes will be chased, old bearings will be removed and all other tasks needed to completely break down the engine will be preformed.  From there the engine will be sent to American Cycle Fabrication for rebuilding and bench testing.  

At this point, the project will continue forward at a rate based on the amount of capital that has been raised.  In order to help insure that I reach my goals, funding for this project comes from four sources; crowdfunding on indiegogo, advertising proceeds from Riding Vintage, articles published in print magazines and the sale of personal assets.  This is a costly endeavor and I'm sure that it will take all four to see this project through to the end.

A completion date of mid-May has been set for having a rideable motorcycle, with hopes of riding it to the AMCA meet in Denton, NC.  This also leaves the entire summer available for breaking in the engine and working out any issues that may arise.  At the beginning of September 2014, the motorcycle will be shipped out to California in preparation for my cross country ride.  That ride will begin mid to late September, with two weeks set aside for the journey across the US.


Distribution of Funds

After careful calculations, I've determined that the minimum cost of purchasing all the necessary parts and assembling a bare bones 1933 VL will be about $15,000.  In comparison, a full restoration would be on the order of $30,000.  That leaves room for a lot of improvements and upgrades that could be made with additional funding.  If the budget permits, I'll first concentrate on changes to the engine to increase power and reliability.  Next I will invest in upgrading the brakes and lighting for increased safety when on the road.  Once those things are covered, I'll worry about other details like paint, additional NOS parts and possibly even a sidecar which would really come in handy for hauling gear and spare parts.  Then there are also the fundamentals like food and gas which I'm sure to need on the trip. 

What Do I Receive As An Individual Sponsor?

Becoming a sponsor will make you part of the Riding Vintage Team, giving you a front row seat to all the action.  As a sponsor you'll be involved with every aspect of this build.  You'll be kept up to date with weekly newsletters, photos, videos and online articles.  Anytime something is happening, you'll be the first to know.  

Ever wonder what it takes to rebuild a vintage engine?  Find out all the details as I have my '33 engine rebuilt by a legendary land speed racer who builds flathead motors that run over 180 miles per hour!  How about a three speed transmission?  You'll see that too.  From wheel bearings to seat springs, it's all going to be covered. 

If you've ever considered restoring your own antique motorcycle, then this in depth look at a top to bottom rebuild will let you know if you have what it takes to do your own.

Do you still want to see more?  Then join us on the road!  Sponsors will have access to our detailed itinerary and chances to see the motorcycle in person as I ride across the United States.

Flash Productions has also agreed to provide copies of several of their books to sponsors of this project.  Featuring the photography of Jim Miteff, these books are a must have for anyone who considers themselves a biker.  For sponsors at the $100 level, they will donate a signed hardback copy of the Collector's Edition of Portraits of American Bikers: Life in the 1960s.  For sponsors at the $175 level, they will donate a signed hardback copy of the Collector's Edition of Portraits of American Bikers: Life in the 1960s and a copy ofPortraits of American Bikers:  Inside Looking Out.  For sponsors at the $250 level, they will donate a signed hardback copy of the Collector's Edition of Portraits of American Bikers: Life in the 1960s and a copy of Portraits of American Bikers:  Inside Looking Out and a copy of Asphalt Range.

What Do I Receive As A Corporate Sponsor?

As a corporate sponsor your brand will be targeted to vintage motorcycle enthusiasts around the globe through digital content, published magazine articles, merchandise and your logo painted on the motorcycle itself.  Digitally, this project will be covered on social media sites like Facebook and Twitter, as well as on popular motorcycle sites like Bikernet, Riding Vintage and a few others soon to be announced.  In print, American Iron Motorcycle Bagger magazine has agreed to publish a series of articles on this project and I am in talks with other editors for in depth articles on the build itself.  Professional quality images of the completed motorcycle will be available for your use in your own print and digital advertising campaigns.

If your company produces parts specifically for the 1933 VL, there is also the opportunity to have your parts used on this motorcycle.  Besides the additional recognition you will receive from articles based on the installation of your parts, at the completion of the ride your parts will have been independently validated on a cross country ride.  This is a great opportunity as the number of VL's making cross country rides these days is minimal at best.   

For motorcycle dealerships, independent shops, museums, etc that are located along the route, this motorcycle would make a great promotional piece for an event at your location.  If time allows, I'd be glad to make a stop and answer questions for your customers during my ride across the country.  Feel free to contact me to discuss the details of your particular case. 

Special Thanks to Our Sponsors

Aesthetically, the 1933 VL is a stunning machine.  It still carries the lightweight look of an early motorcycle thanks to it's open rear fender and minimal options.  The iconic paint scheme was only available for the 1933 model year and is arguably the best that has every come out of Milwaukee.  The '33 also performs as good as it looks, which makes it well suited for this adventure.
The V-series went into production in 1930 to replace the F-head V-twins which had powered Harley's for almost 20 years.  This new side-valve powered motorcycle featured a number of modern improvements like an enclosed valve train, I-beam forged front forks, drop center rims, a duplex primary chain and many others.  All of these combine to make a highly dependable motorcycle, capable of crossing the US.
Besides dependability, the V-series is also relatively fast for an antique machine.  In 1933, the VLE model set an American production motorcycle speed record of 104 mph.  This made them popular with police forces and the following footage taken in 1935 demonstrates their ability to reach speeds over 100 mph. 

I don't plan on riding mine at those speeds, but this shows that a VL can handle speeds found on today's modern highways.  
Details
Work will officially begin on the VL at the end of November on Black Friday.  The first step is to prepare the engine for rebuilding.  Appropriate engine parts will be cleaned, bead blasted and painted per original factory specifications.  All threaded holes will be chased, old bearings will be removed and all other tasks needed to completely break down the engine will be preformed.  From there the engine will be sent to American Cycle Fabrication for rebuilding and bench testing.  
At this point, the project will continue forward at a rate based on the amount of capital that has been raised.  In order to help insure that I reach my goals, funding for this project comes from four sources; crowdfunding on indiegogo, advertising proceeds from Riding Vintage, articles published in print magazines and the sale of personal assets.  This is a costly endeavor and I'm sure that it will take all four to see this project through to the end.
A completion date of mid-May has been set for having a rideable motorcycle, with hopes of riding it to the AMCA meet in Denton, NC.  This also leaves the entire summer available for breaking in the engine and working out any issues that may arise.  At the beginning of September 2014, the motorcycle will be shipped out to California in preparation for my cross country ride.  That ride will begin mid to late September, with two weeks set aside for the journey across the US.






Distribution of Funds
After careful calculations, I've determined that the minimum cost of purchasing all the necessary parts and assembling a bare bones 1933 VL will be about $15,000.  In comparison, a full restoration would be on the order of $30,000.  That leaves room for a lot of improvements and upgrades that could be made with additional funding.  If the budget permits, I'll first concentrate on changes to the engine to increase power and reliability.  Next I will invest in upgrading the brakes and lighting for increased safety when on the road.  Once those things are covered, I'll worry about other details like paint, additional NOS parts and possibly even a sidecar which would really come in handy for hauling gear and spare parts.  Then there are also the fundamentals like food and gas which I'm sure to need on the trip. 


What Do I Receive As An Individual Sponsor?

Becoming a sponsor will make you part of the Riding Vintage Team, giving you a front row seat to all the action.  As a sponsor you'll be involved with every aspect of this build.  You'll be kept up to date with weekly newsletters, photos, videos and online articles.  Anytime something is happening, you'll be the first to know.  
Ever wonder what it takes to rebuild a vintage engine?  Find out all the details as I have my '33 engine rebuilt by a legendary land speed racer who builds flathead motors that run over 180 miles per hour!  How about a three speed transmission?  You'll see that too.  From wheel bearings to seat springs, it's all going to be covered. 
If you've ever considered restoring your own antique motorcycle, then this in depth look at a top to bottom rebuild will let you know if you have what it takes to do your own.
Do you still want to see more?  Then join us on the road!  Sponsors will have access to our detailed itinerary and chances to see the motorcycle in person as I ride across the United States.
Flash Productions has also agreed to provide copies of several of their books to sponsors of this project.  Featuring the photography of Jim Miteff, these books are a must have for anyone who considers themselves a biker.  For sponsors at the $100 level, they will donate a signed hardback copy of the Collector's Edition of Portraits of American Bikers: Life in the 1960s.  For sponsors at the $175 level, they will donate a signed hardback copy of the Collector's Edition of Portraits of American Bikers: Life in the 1960s and a copy ofPortraits of American Bikers:  Inside Looking Out.  For sponsors at the $250 level, they will donate a signed hardback copy of the Collector's Edition of Portraits of American Bikers: Life in the 1960s and a copy of Portraits of American Bikers:  Inside Looking Out and a copy of Asphalt Range.


What Do I Receive As A Corporate Sponsor?
As a corporate sponsor your brand will be targeted to vintage motorcycle enthusiasts around the globe through digital content, published magazine articles, merchandise and your logo painted on the motorcycle itself.  Digitally, this project will be covered on social media sites like Facebook and Twitter, as well as on popular motorcycle sites like Bikernet, Riding Vintage and a few others soon to be announced.  In print, American Iron Motorcycle Bagger magazine has agreed to publish a series of articles on this project and I am in talks with other editors for in depth articles on the build itself.  Professional quality images of the completed motorcycle will be available for your use in your own print and digital advertising campaigns.
If your company produces parts specifically for the 1933 VL, there is also the opportunity to have your parts used on this motorcycle.  Besides the additional recognition you will receive from articles based on the installation of your parts, at the completion of the ride your parts will have been independently validated on a cross country ride.  This is a great opportunity as the number of VL's making cross country rides these days is minimal at best.   
For motorcycle dealerships, independent shops, museums, etc that are located along the route, this motorcycle would make a great promotional piece for an event at your location.  If time allows, I'd be glad to make a stop and answer questions for your customers during my ride across the country.  Feel free to contact me to discuss the details of your particular case. 


Special Thanks to Our Sponsors

story:
How it works?

Hardware:

The Train Vision System consists of a LiDAR, FLIR camera, and a dashboard camera mounted on the locomotive.

Software:

The algorithms which support the Train Vision System consist of the track identification algorithm, and the signal state extrapolation algorithm.

1) We identify the track the train is occupying

2) We identify the signal state of the train track

3) We identify where the other trains are present

4) We adjust the throttle on the train and apply brakes if need be

What we are solving?

Train wrecks are incredibly destructive, from casualties on commuter trains to environmental catastrophes on hazardous freight trains. The Federal Railroad Administration’s accident records in the last decade (Tables 1 & 2 below) categorized the various cases of derailments, collisions and crossing accidents to profile gaps in rail safety. Eventually, the deadly Chatsworth, CA train collision of 2008 accelerated the passing of the Federal Safety Improvement Act (Public Law 110-432), which we believe is the beginning of a new chapter in US rail safety. To augment these efforts to increase safety, Solfice Research is proposing to develop a safety enhanced system to reduce the likelihood of derailments and collisions.

It is obvious to conclude from the tables above that human error is the main cause of collisions. One of the biggest infractions is red light violations by the train operators. If the train automatically detects the signal state as the train approaches the signal, red light violations can be averted. The Madera, CA accident on June 14th, 2006 and the Gary, IN crash on January 18th, 1993 are two examples that may have been averted with such technology. Train control systems such as Positive Train Control (PTC) use network-wide and nationwide train position tracking to ensure that no collisions occur between any two trains. However, the GPS (and differential GPS) localization used by PTC for achieving this goal is insufficient in regions of high track density due to the precision needed to identify specific track occupancy by a train. 


In addition to human error the other main cause of accidents is “faulty track lines”. (Table 1) We could avoid many of these accidents if we develop technologies to:

1. Stop trains automatically or remotely in addition to cautioning/forcing train operators to follow certain recommendations and 

2. Detect faulty track lines in real-time, thus providing timely warning to control stations.


Solfice Research is developing technologies to avoid both train-to-train collisions and derailments. Our technology mitigates the human component by integrating camera-based signal detection with the braking and acceleration interface, thus facilitating the automatic or remote breaking and conductor notifications. This would be instrumental in deterring certain derailments, where excessive speed is at the root of the accident (e.g. Kensington, MD on July 29, 2002). 


In addition to enabling Positive Train Control technologies, Solfice Research technology will allow for constant monitoring of the track. Fusing high-resolution imaging output with on-board vibration measurements, we hope to detect dangerous track conditions. Comparing the data in real-time with historical recordings, we aim at devising decision algorithms for adjusting locomotive speeds for safer train operation, as well as optimal preventive track maintenance. For example, early detection of fatigue may have prevented the environmental disaster near Superior, WI on June 30, 1992. Certain kinks in the tracks, much like the ones that caused the May 9, 2009 derailment near Palm Coast, FL might not have gone undetected by the high resolution cameras.


A low cost vision based solution that enables a network-wide PTC implementation with interoperability between the operators is essential for enabling a safer railway system, and compliance with the Railway Safety Improvement Act of 2008.

Core Competencies at Solfice Research, Inc.

Solfice Research, Inc. has core expertise in computer vision, wireless sensor networks, and control algorithms. The principal investigator, Sravan Puttagunta, authored a video based automatic content recognition algorithm, used by Samba.tv, currently in use by 30 million Smart TVs. The domain expertise accrued while working on automatic content recognition enhances the firm’s ability to deal with large scale datasets for real time processing.


Solfice Research was also invited to participate in Super Techies 2013 based on its domain expertise.

The firm also has core competencies in developing systems for operating in rugged train environments as exemplified by the Solfice Intelligent Driver Display Unit (HMI device).



Experience of Company and Team

Sravan Puttagunta, CEO, serial entrepreneur and computer vision specialist, Inventor of Samba TV’s video based content recognition algorithm, NSF Bay Area I-Corps Graduate, M.S. in EECS at UC Berkeley, B.S. in Computer Engineering at CSU Chico.

Provisional patents in:

●  SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR TRAIN CONTROL USING LOCOMOTIVE MOUNTED COMPUTER VISION TO EXTRAPOLATE TRACK ID AND SIGNAL STATE

Fabien Chraim, CTO, wireless sensor network researcher, Internet of Things specialist; Ph.D. in EECS at UC Berkeley in progress, M.S. in Civil Systems at UC Berkeley, B.S. in ECE at American University of Beirut.

Jason Creadore, COO, financial analyst and business developer with tech and government clients at NYSE’s IPO group and J.P. Morgan’s Public Finance group, B.S. in Finance at Lehigh University. 

Outcome

  • We are asking for $150,000.00 dollars to get started on this ambitious project to help improve safety and efficiency of US Railways. Rail is the cheapest and most economically friendly way to transport goods on the surface. We are seeking to help improve the efficiency of the rail industry by deploying our remote sensing system on-board trains.
  • Our perks include everything from a thank you note, a dinner with our CEO to a complete train set for your kids to play with.
  • We will refund any unused funds. Each system costs about 50k to design and develop. We hope to deploy in 50k increments. If we don't reach the initial 50k, we will refund the entire amount. If we cross 50k we will get started on our research work.

The Impact

As mentioned above, most PTC implementations use something called a Wayside Interface Unit (WIU). This system costs roughly $25,000 per unit for just the hardware and requires supporting infrastructure that costs another $25,000 to deploy. In addition, the Positive Train Control communication antennas are also a prerequisite for the hardware to communicate to a central backend control station. Extrapolating on these costs, the FRA forecasted an expenditure of $13.2 billion for deploying PTC systems in major U.S. railroads including those owned or operated by Union Pacific, BNSF, Amtrak, CSX, and Norfolk Southern by the end of FY 2015.

Using TVS, railway operators can achieve the same levels of safety and functionality by relying on machine vision to extrapolate the state of the signal in the track segment and identifying the track ID at a much lower price. Listed are the advantages of TVS:

1. This remote sensing based approach when added to the current rail ecosystems enables the train to obtain context without heavy reliance on signaling equipment. Currently a train needs constant communication with wayside transponders resulting in plenty of integration overhead to coordinate within a PTC ecosystem. In addition, the locomotive should be interoperable with antiquated signaling infrastructure regardless of PTC compliance by the railroad infrastructure. Therefore, one of the goals of TVS is to also enable trains to operate in an ecosystem that is not currently PTC enabled.

To enable this, the locomotive will be equipped with 3D LIDAR (Light detection and ranging) scanners & FLIR cameras to extrapolate information about the environment constantly in real time.  The locomotive can now detect and isolate which train track it's currently occupying. This functionality would enable the train to augment the current signaling infrastructure that might or might not be PTC compliant to ensure higher line capacity and better safety envelopes.

A similar analogy would be if you are driving down a dark road in a car:

1) The road can have thousands of street lights alongside the road to illuminate the path;

2) Or the car can utilize its headlights to see what is in front of the vehicle;

3) Or both approaches can complement each other to generate a more comprehensive view

By taking that analogy to heart, the strategic value addition of TVS is when the train is passing through "dark territory" where signaling equipment doesn't exist. TVS can provide information to the operator to enable PTC in “dark territory”. We fuse the information obtained from the train onboard signal bus (odometer & directional heading), GPS coordinates, and the vision based extrapolation of track ID. The communication platform on the train can obtain the track offset position from the vision apparatus in TVS and query the backend with the GPS coordinates to checkout a track ID.

2. The system is scalable since the train vision system can use image-stitching algorithms along with the point cloud datasets from the 3D LIDAR scanner to accurately calculate the train position to the centimeter using off the shelf components. In comparison, GPS is not accurate at a sub-meter level without deploying expensive wayside hardware. It is a much better approach to augment the GPS positional data with another orthogonal measurement and utilize data fusion techniques to get centimeter level accuracy.

3. Trains can determine their location without relying on signaling and can report their position to nearby trains. Even in territories where there is no signaling infrastructure, trains can collaborate and synchronize their speeds to prevent collisions. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have cash?

  • You can contribute towards our project by joining the team and coding for us.
  • If you like our idea and know like minded individuals who would fund our efforts, please share our idea on Indigogo.

Hope you enjoy the increased safety and efficiency of the trains the next time you send a freight package to your friends or ride the train out of town.

story:
Electric scooters are transforming urban life. While running errands in your city or doing sightseeing on your trip, scooters help you to move around quickly and conveniently. The most needed improvement in this growing market is a phone holder specifically designed for scooters. After riding scooters in major cities such as San Francisco and Washington D.C. for years, we developed Scooty: The First and Ultimate Phone Holder for Scooters.

Scooty is compatible with all phones along with all scooters, including rental scooters from companies like Lime, Bird, Lyft, Razor, and Skip. Scooty is an expandable holder with 360-degree rotation, making it easy to set up with all phone sizes. A flexible and adjustable body offers a comfortable ride for any purpose that any person could use.

 

 

After extensive testing, we chose the best designs and materials for the clamp, body, and holder to provide quality and durability. We finalized a prototype that is flexible and adjustable while maintaining resistance to vibrations and environmental factors up to 15 mph! Perfect for those days you may be running late for work.

 

 

Scooty is able to fit any Scooter and is easy-to-use for all ages and adjustable for all heights. Scooty helps you along your ride by recording videos, providing directions, playing music, and everything else your phone has to offer.

No more stopping to check the map, Scooty allows you to view your Phone GPS when and where you need it most. Enjoy your city views while listening to music on your ride. Take a Selfie video or record your surroundings with ease and hands-free. Make a call or send a message using Siri, Google Assistant, or Cortana. Scooty is there to make your ride more fun and convenient!

 

 

Scooty provides a 5-Second legendary setup and detachment, conveniently providing Scooty as your best companion during the scooter ride in your fast-paced daily routine or an adventurous sightseeing trip!

 

We are a computer engineer (Ned) and environmental engineer (Kristina) who love riding scooters, just like you! An electric scooter is not just a vehicle to get chores done. It's a fun company to discover the city and suburbs! We spent months on perfecting Scooty by discussing and designing every angle carefully to maximize the comfort and convenience of your scooter rides!

 

We spoke with four manufacturers. The average amount of budget required for the mass production of the holder, clamp, and 7-section body is $3500. Manufacturers offered 1-2 months delivery timeline. Upon completion of the Indiegogo campaign at the end of June,  we are going to start shipping the Scooty to our backers in August.

 

 

As a big THANK YOU for your support to better scooter rides, we are giving a Razor scooter helmet to our backers who refer two friends to our campaign page (Try Razor's scooters as well if they are in your city!).

In order to refer friends and receive a FREE helmet:

  • Log in to your Indiegogo account
  • Share the campaign link by clicking the social media buttons on the campaign page
  • At least two people should back the campaign with your referral
  • You can track your referrals through your Indiegogo profile
  • No extra shipping charge for the helmet!

story:
Pon is:

Easy. Just slide what you want to display inside the coil. There's even a special angle in the coil that allows for objects to be inserted without crumpling.

Flexible. Pon was designed to have just the right amount of spirals to maintain a full grip and can hold thick objects like coasters and album jackets, or many layers of small objects like reminder notes. It's made from heat-treated stainless steel, which allows it to spring back to it's original shape even after it's expanded.

Small. About the same size as a regular thumb tack. 

Strong. Pon can do some serious heavy lifting.

Versatile. You can now express yourself and display things you would have previously stashed in a drawer or shoebox.

Ready to go. Pon has been prototyped extensively and fine tuned to have the best tolerances for the most amount of jobs. 

Made in The USA. We've explored where to make Pon and have been lucky enough to find an exceptional and experienced local manufacturer ready to go.

Easy. Just slide what you want to display inside the coil. There's even a special angle in the coil that allows for objects to be inserted without crumpling.


Flexible. Pon was designed to have just the right amount of spirals to maintain a full grip and can hold thick objects like coasters and album jackets, or many layers of small objects like reminder notes. It's made from heat-treated stainless steel, which allows it to spring back to it's original shape even after it's expanded.


Small. About the same size as a regular thumb tack. 


Strong. Pon can do some serious heavy lifting.


Versatile. You can now express yourself and display things you would have previously stashed in a drawer or shoebox.


Ready to go. Pon has been prototyped extensively and fine tuned to have the best tolerances for the most amount of jobs. 


Made in The USA. We've explored where to make Pon and have been lucky enough to find an exceptional and experienced local manufacturer ready to go.

story:
The Skinny

The Green Monster is an invention thought up by me, Thad Oviatt, that securely holds and charges your electric bicycle. This all started to help my friends from getting their bicycles stolen all the time in college.  The same issues that I experienced on campus were happening all over the city streets. I later saw the need for not only security but charging as the bicycling community adopted more electric bicycles onto the roads.

I need your help raising $5,000 to build the NEXT generation of Green Monsters for your and my community!

 

The Turning Point in Design

Last year I went through a program called Flashpoint, a business accelerator program at Georgia Tech. During the program I found out about electric bicycles and how severely under served they are. There are virtually ZERO places to securely charge a bicycle. At that point I decided to evolve The Green Monster from secured parking into a secured charging station.  

Now 'The Green Monster LIVES' again as a Secure Charging Station for Electric Bicycles.

Each Green Monster can individually hold 2 bicycles at a time. The stations can be linked together and they can securely hold most types of bicycle. A phone app activates the station through Bluetooth. Located on the Green Monster are AC Outlets (110 V) that energize once a bicycle is securely parked.

iOS and Android Phone App
Each user creates their personal PIN code that accesses the stations for parking and charging. Our app is designed to locate available stations in real time. Once at a station location you have exclusive local deals & steals!

 

Your contribution will help us build the NEXT STATION!

 

Public Testing

Over the last 3 years we've tested The Green Monster out in public. Thankfully over 800 people have tried it out and most of them loved it! On one happy occasion we discovered children can use it intuitively. With the ability to secure almost every bicycle on the market, means that the kids bikes are safe too!

    

 

The Impact

Every bike shop I’ve been to from Michigan to Georgia are selling electric bicycles. In the Flashpoint program I found out in 2017 there were 100,000 more electric bicycles sold than electric cars. Earlier this year it was reported in 2018 the electric bicycle market doubled in size. The problem is there are over 60,000 car charging stations across the nation and virtually ZERO places to securely charge a bicycle!

60,000 Car Charging Stations in the United States

Building this next station it will show property managers, investors, and municipalities the need for infrastructure to support alternative modes of Micromobility transportation.

The amazing part is these stations are cost-neutral and are essentially FREE. All of the electric vehicle (EV) charging rebates and electric vehicle supply equipment (EVSE) tax incentives normally applied to car charging stations apply to these stations.

Why? Because bicycles are vehicles by law!

Locations could receive a 40% BOOST in revenue when stations are installed! - CITYLAB

 

 

What We Need

$5,000 to Build the NEXT Charging Station! 

For the past six years we've been working out my parent’s garage.

Through friends and family funding we were able to get capital for first stations to be manufactured at SWIFT Atlanta in Suwanee, Georgia. Now we are renting a warehouse at Orb Manufacturing in Woodstock, Georgia, to assemble the Green Monsters. Your funds will go to purchasing the electronics and cost of labor needed to assemble the next stations.

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The main risk / obstacle is not getting the capital needed to build the next stations for further prototyping and pilot programs. 

For the past 10 years we've been studying the newly named Micromobility market. 

Over those past six years we’ve:

  1. Managed to gather enough money to rapidly prototype the hardware and software through several prototypes
  2. Secured a patent on the station
  3. Received help from the Georgia Tech Capstone program, GaMEP, ATDC.org, and the Flashpoint Accelerator program

The plan is to get the next station built and install it into a heavily bicycle trafficked area around metro Atlanta. There are several ideal places like along the Atlanta BeltLine, transportation hubs, the Midtown Atlanta area, or the newly developing Peachtree Creek Greenway.

 

Testimonials

 
   
   
   

 

The Crazies behind the Green Monster

The 'We' is myself, my business partner / father / using his garage Mark Oviatt, and my contracted graphic designer and sister Alessandra Shahan!

      

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Do you know of an area of heavy bicycle traffic?
  • Do you know of a business looking for more people to stop by?
  • Spread the word of 'The Green Monster'

Thank You for making it this far in our campaign! We do appreciate you taking the time to read the whole thing.

Would you like to know more?! 

Find out the rest on our website www.parkentcycles.com

 

What You Get - The Swag!

The higher perk you pick, gets you one of each below it.

  1. $1.00 - Because You Like Us! Drop us a buck because you like our stuff! 
  2. $5.00 - Totally Awesome News! Get on the mailing list for updates and the first launch. Become a part of the electric bike charging community!
  3. $10.00 - Button with the ParkENT Cycles Bicycle LOGO 
  4. $50.00 - Printed Logo T-Shirt: A cool printed logo t-shirt with the Cycle logo on the front. The back will have PARKENT CYCLES and the Cycle logo printed large! 
  5. $150.00 - Logo Embroidered Polo: The ParkENT Cycles logo is stitched on the front to grab people's attention.
